There are two important reasons for this change:
 - Other OpenStack components contain this code already.
 - Heat store references on client/constraint/version plugins in

   install Heat after changing this part of code. As example look patch
   https://review.openstack.org/#/c/86978/ for grenade job, where
   heat-engine can not find two constrainsts due to changing their code
   place between releases.

commit_message:
Adding installation Heat package after cloning

There are two important reasons for this change:
 - Other OpenStack components contain this code already.
 - Heat store references on client/constraint/version plugins in
   setup.cfg and and stevedore uses these references, so we should
   install Heat after changing this part of code. As example look patch
   https://review.openstack.org/#/c/86978/ for grenade job, where
   heat-engine can not find two constrainsts due to changing their code
   place between releases.

Change-Id: Ic6b1f70ec2d2c06002eb6877a747b7b84213c710
Closes-Bug: #1402985

commit_message:
Trove configure authtoken via conf file

Configure auth_token middleware in trove via the conf file rather than
the paste pipeline. This is the standard and expected mechanism.

Change-Id: Iec6bf74c9321082c35465d332aba7f5fa240cc1a

[{'created': '2015-01-07 12:49:06.000000000', 'message': "global-requirements: Update oslo.db to 1.1.3

With current Neutron master (commit: 98c53d5), and oslo.db 1.1.0,
DevStack setup fails with:

[. . .]
context(dependent_req)\npkg_resources.ContextualVersionConflict: (SQLAlchemy 0.9.8 (/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages), Requirement.parse(\'SQLAlchem
y<=0.8.99,<=0.9.99,>=0.8.4,>=0.9.7\'), set([\'oslo.db\']))\n'
2015-01-07 06:48:11.110 CRITICAL neutron [-] RuntimeError:
Command: ['sudo', '/usr/bin/neutron-rootwrap', '/etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf', 'ovs-vsctl', '--timeout=10', '--', 'set-fail-mode', 'br-int', 'secure']
Exit code: 1
Stdout: ''
[. . .]

A manual 'pip uninstall oslo.db && pip install oslo.db' fetches 1.1.3,
fixing this issue.

So, update oslo.db version to 1.1.3 in global-requirements.txt.

Change-Id: I590a5049e0b4b6cbe0bfcdff472bbef5d7505bdb
"}, {'created': '2015-01-07 13:05:46.000000000', 'message': "global-requirements: Update oslo.db to 1.1.3

oslo.db 1.1.0 doesn't fulfil requirements for SQLAlchemy -- with current
Neutron git master (commit: 98c53d5), and oslo.db 1.1.0, DevStack
invocation fails with version conflicts. Updating oslo.db to 1.1.3 fixes
it.

So, update oslo.db version to 1.1.3 in global-requirements.txt.

Change-Id: I590a5049e0b4b6cbe0bfcdff472bbef5d7505bdb

commit_message:
global-requirements: Update oslo.db to 1.3.0

oslo.db 1.1.0 doesn't fulfil requirements for SQLAlchemy -- with current
Neutron git master (commit: 98c53d5) and oslo.db 1.1.0, DevStack
invocation fails with version conflicts. Updating oslo.db to 1.3.0 fixes
it.

So, update oslo.db version to 1.3.0 in global-requirements.txt.

Change-Id: I590a5049e0b4b6cbe0bfcdff472bbef5d7505bdb

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be

    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others

    great way to learn the code base.

When using unstack.sh script on Debian Wheezy, i saw a failing call on
uuidgen binary:

    $ ./unstack.sh
    /home/stack/devstack/lib/neutron: line 83: uuidgen: command not found

Change-Id: I47e158abce9d090eb839c6e97d9191dc99ccfe55

commit_message:
uuidgen binary is needed by lib/{neutron,ceph}

When using unstack.sh script on Debian Wheezy, i saw a failing call on
uuidgen binary:

    $ ./unstack.sh
    /home/stack/devstack/lib/neutron: line 83: uuidgen: command not found
    Site keystone disabled.
    [...]

Change-Id: I47e158abce9d090eb839c6e97d9191dc99ccfe55

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-07 07:06:18.000000000', 'message': 'Do not modify rsyslog files if rsyslog is not used.

Swift was missing an 'if [[ $SYSLOG != "False" ]]' statement which is used
by other services, and therefor failed with a 'No such file or directory'
error when 'SYSLOG=False' was set in localrc.

Closes-Bug: 1308461

Change-Id: I8655a955ebb322516d92bee418b93d4cc23bdc5c
(cherry picked from commit f894c2ab805f9dfc0dfdd3668ccd3a83ee4eb9f2)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not modify rsyslog files if rsyslog is not used.

Swift was missing an 'if [[ $SYSLOG != "False" ]]' statement which is used
by other services, and therefor failed with a 'No such file or directory'
error when 'SYSLOG=False' was set in localrc.

Closes-Bug: 1308461

Change-Id: I8655a955ebb322516d92bee418b93d4cc23bdc5c
(cherry picked from commit f894c2ab805f9dfc0dfdd3668ccd3a83ee4eb9f2)

commit_message:
let endpoint_filter sql backend return dict data

Manager or controller should adapt different backends. This requires
all backends return the same data structure(keystone uses dict). But,
currently, some list methods in contrib/endpoint_filter/backends/sql.py
return db object.

Change-Id: I30e9a0fecb1c6af67e9704b777e5822797d1b7f5
Closes-Bug: #1405710

commit_message:
Install additional oslo modules in guest image

The change (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/141081/) moves trove from
using processutils.py (oslo-incubator) to oslo.concurrency. This must
be reflected in the guest image.

Change 141081 depends on this change.

Change-Id: If98ec4ee8816f715c3b3146aba0ada989b841674
Partial-Bug: #1380789

[{'created': '2014-12-04 23:18:31.000000000', 'message': "Add obj_as_admin() to NovaPersistentObject

Since this is a nova-ism, I'm adding this to our subclass of NovaObject,
which we use for almost everything, and at least everything that will care
about this. Later, we should probably generalize a layer between the base
and NovaPersistentObject classes for things like this.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: I0aed6e19446febd3350b15f63a2855604dd9d5c3

Since this is a nova-ism, I'm adding this to our subclass of NovaObject,

commit_message:
Add obj_as_admin() to NovaPersistentObject

Since this is a nova-ism, I'm adding this to our subclass of NovaObject,
which we use for almost everything, and at least everything that will care
about this. Later, we should probably generalize a layer between the base
and NovaPersistentObject classes for things like this.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: I0aed6e19446febd3350b15f63a2855604dd9d5c3

commit_message:
Angular xstatic for Version 1.3.7

Adding version 1.3.7
1.3.x angular is needed for Horizon launch instance work.

This was dependent on the following (done):
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/142520/

Xstatic-Angular 1.3.7 includes the following packages:

XStatic-Angular-Cookies
XStatic-Angular-Mock

They can be removed, but this apparently needs to be done
in a multi-step process. The interdependency chain,
(horizon has dependency on the old packages) causes
an integration test to fail. So, if we follow the normal
process, then we have to do it in the following order.

1) The newer pakage has to be added to global requirements
2) a) The new dependency has to be added to Horizon
   b) Old dependencies must be removed from Horizon
3) The older packages must be removed from global requirements
   - change 145096

At least this what I can tell how to make it all
work following processes since I can't modify the
requirements across projects in the same patch set.

Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign

Change-Id: Ibd171723c6b7ba672c90daf35ae88f672e8d5f4e

3. Groups are referenced by variables

Still things to improve:

2. registering spread across the project (should be in one place)

commit_message:
Cleaned up config generator settings

1. Sahara opts are listed once
2. Oslo incubator opts are listed separately
3. Groups are referenced by variables

Still things to improve:
1. opt-group mapping is listed twice now (in reg and in list)
2. registering spread across the project (should be in one place)
3. dependancies are not managed (it should be one place with CONF)

Change-Id: I4b8edf26187b3c23d08f9efbee42086652efea5a
Closes-Bug: #1407834

I understand the desire to have coverage for this area of code, and that they would have caught the recent regression. That being said, let's not lose perspective - These tests are useless.

If this patch came before the fix to the regression, I think you would have -2'd it yourself Armando. The way to catch these types of errors is via integration tests, which you already have."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2014-12-25 17:09:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I understand the desire to have coverage for this area of code, and that they would have caught the recent regression. That being said, let's not lose perspective - These tests are useless.

I beg to differ: different levels of coverage are not mutually exclusive. Just because integration testing would've caught this, it doesn't mean that everything must go through integration testing. You should know better!

That said, you seem to miss the point: the integration testing for DVR is not voting now; so I need a stronger safety net; I wish I had this one, when the regression was introduced so that it would have stopped it to sneak in the first place.

Now you'd argue, let's make the DVR job voting, but I wish it was that simple..."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2014-12-25 17:10:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-12-25 19:02:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

- check-tempest-dsvm-neutron-dvr http://logs.openstack.org/78/143778/1/check/check-tempest-dsvm-neutron-dvr/dd62845/ : FAILURE in 48m 09s (non-voting)
- gate-neutron-pylint http://logs.openstack.org/78/143778/1/check/gate-neutron-pylint/8d8e8eb/ : SUCCESS in 3m 42s'}, {'account_id': 8873, 'date': '2014-12-26 08:54:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I beg to differ: different levels of coverage are not mutually exclusive. Just because integration testing would've caught this, it doesn't mean that everything must go through integration testing. You should know better!

I'm well aware of different levels of testing. I'm saying that at the unit level, unit testing a function with 2 lines of code by mocking out the entire contents of that function... I don't know. I implore you to find a better way to get coverage at the unit level without introducing new tests that:
1) Don't validate behavior, merely validate the very specific current implementation by mocking out the entire contents of the function.
2) Are a very big departure from validating that for a certain input you get the expected output.

Basically we want to make sure that we use the new RPC interface throughout the entire code base. If i'm not mistaken, we're already there.

Do other RPC methods have similar tests? Why not?

Some food for thought..."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2015-01-04 04:17:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

At the risk of echoing Assaf's comments, I don't see how these tests do anything more than duplicate the logic of the code.  If test additions are required, I think we can do better than double-entry accounting via mock-based behavior verification."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2015-01-05 17:06:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I honestly think that this does not warrant any more time and energy: if the logic under tests is simple, I don't understand why the tests must be convoluted. These tests, albeit trivial, do the job of catching any sneaky error in the rpc layer, which is supposed to be the intention of testing all along.

Ultimately we got stung by this because people tend to ignore non-voting tempest job. I felt that adding trivial unit coverage was enough to give us a better safety net until the DVR job becomes voting (in which case issues like this would be detected effectively).

I don't expect any other RPC overhaul for the foreseeable future, so perhaps these tests are useless after all. I was just following up with the fix that was filed without tests.

If you guys feel strongly that this change is highly controversial and an eyesore in the shiny picture of the way we do testing in Neutron, I am more than happy to abandon this change and move on :)"}, {'account_id': 7787, 'date': '2015-01-07 05:13:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This test doesn't make me that upset, but I did find a nit inline!"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2015-01-07 19:56:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2015-01-08 02:04:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add coverage to AttributeError in RPC code for DVR

Commit eff0b350 did not include tests for this error. This patch
completes the efforts.

Closes-bug: #1394848

Change-Id: I58874512965ae0754caa8db38372f21f2b829e74

commit_message:
Extracted config check from pep8 to separate env

Pep8 is broken after each oslo update. Extracted config check to
a separate env. Next step - add this env to Jenkins (or sahara-ci)
as non-voting job once it is merged.

Change-Id: I58940e9606d736412c2c653ddb4ad4d09e6edcea
Closes-Bug: #1408053

commit_message:
Use schema instead of hard coded index

The previous version of these tempest tests uses a hard coded index to pick
the ID field from the congress table which is fragile.  This change uses the
schema and the column name to determine the index.

Change-Id: I5ed04db0cec3d3132fd6bfdce2d6dbc658f0638d

commit_message:
Make indexing work for joins

This speeds up evaluation from a linear search O(n) to a hash table lookup
O(1).  This speedup can be quite large when dealing with large datasets.

Change-Id: Icd5341ddd3a868edd1814c0ef9436cafba6bdd22

commit_message:
Update iptables to support variable Horizon port

When SSL is enabled, iptables must allow traffic on port
443 for HTTPS access to the Horizon UI.

When SSL is disabled, iptables should continue to open
port 80 for traditional HTTP access.

Implementation depends on Iec475a6c245a5bfe8b1d63ff72b6d0299861615c

Change-Id: I0593597beb616af2d4949a1b28307a9e1a5eebbe

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-06 16:36:56.000000000', 'message': 'Customizing tempest configuration for libvirt-lxc

In order to support the continued testing of the libvirt driver
with lxc virtualization, certain compute features must be disabled
including rescue, resize, and suspend.

Change-Id: I52150fef11ba6e3ab2fd0acacaa3c64413c0c0d1
'}]
commit_message:
Customizing tempest configuration for libvirt-lxc

In order to support the continued testing of the libvirt driver
with lxc virtualization, certain compute features must be disabled
including rescue, resize, and suspend.

Change-Id: I52150fef11ba6e3ab2fd0acacaa3c64413c0c0d1

commit_message:
Refactor to separate RuleSet

This separates the logic to associate a set of rules with a particular table.
This will make it easier to implement indexing for table joins.

Change-Id: I338c37df6f9970de56ac4a3c239d9e7f17f1e7a2

commit_message:
Add Process class helper to manage processes with namespace

This class extends Popen class with usage of namespace and root-helper.
Because of usage of root wrapper, this class re-uses get_child_pid() for
killing the child process. get_child_pid() is taken out of AsyncProcess
as a part of this patch.

Change-Id: I856b3ec75f347ecccaf4a1c6fd17b28a33ee1a3f
Related-Bug: 1243216

commit_message:
py3: use six.moves.range instead of xrange

six is the canonical compatibility library for supporting
Python 2 and 3 in a single codebase.

The xrange module  was removed in Python 3 and we should
use 'six.moves.range' instead of 'xrange' to make
code compatible with py 2 and 3 as well.

Partially-implements blueprint py3-compatibility

Change-Id: Id054857f320d9eda02bc0b82e5512c0595342290

'}, {'created': '2015-01-06 01:36:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a transient test failure in test_keystonev2

This test fetches data directly from keystone and congress and compares them.
However, the test is not synchronized with whatever inserts data into
keystone, so when the test starts, keystone might not have all the data.
While the test is running, keystone gets more data and gives the data to
congress.  This causes the test to think congress has users that keystone does
not, leading to a KeyError.

This changes makes the test fetch data from keystone and congress each time
the test tries to compare the two.  This ensures that eventually, the two
datasets converge.  It also avoids the KeyError when the congress data has
something keystone does not.

Change-Id: Ie5e6c82ae2777921d1c6367e5297351455f69683

commit_message:
Fix a transient test failure in tempest tests

The previous version of these tests fetch data directly from the data service
and from congress and compares the two responses.  However, the test is not
synchronized with whatever inserts data into the data service, so when the
test starts, the data service might not have all the data.  While the test is
running, the data service can get more data and give the data to congress.
This causes the test to think congress has data that the data service does
not, leading to a KeyError.

This changes makes the test fetch data from the data service and congress each
time the test tries to compare the two.  This ensures that eventually, the two
datasets converge.  It also avoids the KeyError when the congress data has
something the data service does not.

Change-Id: Ie5e6c82ae2777921d1c6367e5297351455f69683

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-06 21:56:48.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Make sure that tox uses python2 by default"

Python2 is not a binary installed on all systems - we should find a
better way to run only python2.7 by setting it in the envlist

This reverts commit 3936226d945755933505a3627a5d55cbacb4330f.

Change-Id: Ie498dca57cf262c8b3e61e210e2f89c6a7d5e0fb
'}, {'created': '2015-01-07 19:58:26.000000000', 'message': 'Change Python2 to Python2.7

"Python2" is not a binary installed on all systems.

Change-Id: Ie498dca57cf262c8b3e61e210e2f89c6a7d5e0fb
'}]
commit_message:
Change Python2 to Python2.7

"Python2" is not a binary installed on all systems.

Change-Id: Ie498dca57cf262c8b3e61e210e2f89c6a7d5e0fb

subject: Implements opencontrail extension support
messages:
[{'account_id': 7002, 'date': '2015-01-06 10:07:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-01-06 10:17:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-neutron-specs-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/83/145183/1/check/gate-neutron-specs-docs/c12fdf5//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 46s
- gate-neutron-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/83/145183/1/check/gate-neutron-specs-python27/ae436ed/ : SUCCESS in 1m 54s'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2015-01-06 19:24:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

NOT NEEDED DUE TO VENDOR DECOMPOSITION

Filing a spec is no longer necessary due to the ongoing vendor decomposition work.  Please see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/134680/ for more information on the vendor decompostion.  If you require changes to the common Neutron code, please revise this spec and push a new one targeting the work to common Neutron code. For submitting the integration module, you do not need a spec.'}, {'account_id': 7002, 'date': '2015-01-07 07:27:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As per suggested in blueprint for vendor code decomposition.
The Development Strategy suggests, following can reside in tree for the plugin.
* Extension definitions;
* Configuration files;

This blueprint loads the configured extension paths. Config file: contrailplugin.ini
It don't have any implementation for plugin/extension.
I think, This should reside in neutron.
Please correct me in case, I haven't understood it correctly."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2015-01-07 23:50:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yatin: you understood correctly. I was just saying that you don't strictly need to file a blueprint spec if you follow the guidelines suggested for the vendor decomposition code, and especially for smaller code contributions."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2015-01-07 23:50:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-06 10:07:33.000000000', 'message': 'Implements opencontrail extension support

This blueprint is pre-requisite to support opencontrail extension
IPAM, Policy and route-table.

Change-Id: I6e9aba3c1a93bee21f2718fa7a96a10ce11cfe01
Implements: blueprint opencontrail-add-extension-support
'}]
commit_message:
Implements opencontrail extension support

This blueprint is pre-requisite to support opencontrail extension
IPAM, Policy and route-table.

Change-Id: I6e9aba3c1a93bee21f2718fa7a96a10ce11cfe01
Implements: blueprint opencontrail-add-extension-support

commit_message:
Make lb mechanism driver use enable_security_group flag

This patch allows Neutron security groups to be enabled or
disabled with the enable_security_group flag when using the
linuxbridge ml2 mechanism driver.

Closes-Bug: #1398996
Change-Id: I883c67c93e85668cd9d90b0486e448d906fdf8ed

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-17 01:48:29.000000000', 'message': 'Use openstackclient for keystone_tenant

This patch migrates the keystone_tenant provider to use the universal
openstack client instead of the keystone client. It uses the openstack
parent provider in openstacklib to handle multiple authenticating
methods. The keystone_tenant type uses the openstacklib openstack
utility to add a new auth parameter to the keystone_tenant type.

This patch also moves functionality for parsing keystone.conf for the
service token back to the keystone module from openstacklib. It creates
three tiers of inheritance: Keystone_tenant < Keystone < Openstack, so
that keystone-specific functionality can stay in keystone.

This is a proof of concept, and it should probably not be merged until
all the providers in the keystone module are similarly migrated.

Change-Id: I2d9a16f334d1e60ebdd36805e2f8d8d2ef82cf39
'}, {'created': '2014-11-20 19:53:37.000000000', 'message': 'Use openstackclient for keystone_tenant

commit_message:
Use openstackclient for keystone_tenant

This patch migrates the keystone_tenant provider to use the universal
openstack client instead of the keystone client. It uses the openstack
parent provider in openstacklib to handle multiple authenticating
methods. The keystone_tenant type uses the openstacklib openstack
utility to add a new auth parameter to the keystone_tenant type.

This patch also moves functionality for parsing keystone.conf for the
service token back to the keystone module from openstacklib. It creates
three tiers of inheritance: Keystone_tenant < Keystone < Openstack, so
that keystone-specific functionality can stay in keystone.

It also adds a flush method which should help improve performance.

blueprint use-openstackclient-in-module-resources

Change-Id: I2d9a16f334d1e60ebdd36805e2f8d8d2ef82cf39

commit_message:
Remove py26 compatibility code

Resolve any comment about py26. Now that we don't support py26 having
comments explaining that we do X for py26 can lead to confusion.

Change-Id: I1cdef3ed745149a061dfdfff295da63423855d35

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-07 19:32:37.000000000', 'message': "Improve performance of strutils.mask_password

Only apply substitution patterns related to key values that appear in
the string.

Replace .*? in patterns with more explicit patterns that don't require
backtracing.

Add a performance test script for future testing work, with references
to large data files that can be downloaded but that we don't want to
check into the source repository because of their sizes.

Change-Id: Ic3ed252d181c93b8a0db465db6c8c4a7ca97da42
Related-bug: #1408362
"}]
commit_message:
Improve performance of strutils.mask_password

Only apply substitution patterns related to key values that appear in
the string.

Replace .*? in patterns with more explicit patterns that don't require
backtracing.

Add a performance test script for future testing work, with references
to large data files that can be downloaded but that we don't want to
check into the source repository because of their sizes.

Change-Id: Ic3ed252d181c93b8a0db465db6c8c4a7ca97da42
Related-bug: #1408362

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-16 02:45:38.000000000', 'message': "Client output is not sorted by --sort_key

The cinder client supports invoking the volumes REST API with the
sort_dir and sort_key parameters. However, the client output table
is always sorted by ID even though the REST API is returning in
sorted order based on the sort key/direction provided.

For example, the command below supplies the 'size' sort key but the
output table is still sorted by ID:

cinder list --sort_key size --sort_dir desc

This fix contains:
* Updates to the print_list utility to prevent any re-ordering so
  that the current object order is maintained
* Updates to the shell to disable re-ordering if the user supplies
  sort parameters

Change-Id: I4cc111a8bdd2b89158dfc4bb0d16fa6dbf36cc57
Closes-Bug: 1402846
"}, {'created': '2014-12-17 14:36:16.000000000', 'message': "Client output is not sorted by --sort_key

sorted order based on the sort key/direction provided.

For example, the command below supplies the 'size' sort key but the

"}]
commit_message:
Client output is not sorted by --sort_key

The cinder client supports invoking the volumes REST API with the
sort_dir and sort_key parameters. However, the client output table
is always sorted by ID even though the REST API is returning in
sorted order based on the sort key/direction provided.

For example, the command below supplies the 'size' sort key but the
output table is still sorted by ID:

cinder list --sort_key size --sort_dir desc

This fix contains:
* Updates to the print_list utility to prevent any re-ordering so
  that the current object order is maintained
* Updates to the shell to disable re-ordering if the user supplies
  sort parameters

Change-Id: I4cc111a8bdd2b89158dfc4bb0d16fa6dbf36cc57
Closes-Bug: 1402846

commit_message:
Fix proper oslo.messaging object for zeromq driver

Currently, as almost all the rpc driver of projects
have been switched to oslo.messaging, the object should
be imported via oslo.messaging rather than its own rpc lib.

Change-Id: I9633446e78cb5af21f61a26f6fb365a8ed57a85f
Partially-Implements: blueprint zeromq
Closes-Bug: #1395721

commit_message:
Define a new parameter to pass CA cert file

This change adds a new parameter for the swift store driver that allows
to speficy the name of the CA cert file to use in the SSL connections for
verifying certificates. This parameter is passed to the swiftclient in
the creation of the connection. The parameter is called "swift_store_cacert".
This change corresponds to change
I4cbfae3c1ac84d6c85875d34a58dd2a87ae85d6f in glance.

Change-Id: I5b356170ec82d033204e22f79c862201400a0a31
Closes-bug: 1375857
DocImpact

commit_message:
Fix argument order in assertEqual: tests/test_glusterfs.py

The assertEqual in cinder/tests/test_glusterfs.py is using
incorrect argument order (observed, expected), which causes the
error message about mismatch to be reversed if the test case fails.
Change it to (expected, observed).

Change-Id: Idcd88de9c5e8a096f0ef473e92bff17e6be16814
Partial-Bug: #1259292

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-29 18:52:25.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Implement single SVM mode for Generic driver

Add possibility to run Generic driver in single SVM mode. It allows us
to create shares without share-networks defined on one specific Nova VM.

Added three (3) new config options that are used only with single SVM mode:
- 'service_instance_name_or_id' expects string with name or id of Nova VM.
- 'service_net_name_or_ip' expects name of network that Nova VM is switched to
  or IP itself. Used for handle operation of share.
- 'tenant_net_name_or_ip' expects name of network that Nova VM is switched to
  or IP itself. Used for exporting share to end users.

All three new config option are required if single SVM mode is enabled.
If multi SVM mode is enabled they will be skipped.

Set config opt 'share_driver_mode' within devstack by default because in case
of Generic driver it becomes required. It is set to 'multi_svm' for
compatibility with existing Tempest jobs.

It is now mandatory to set up config opt 'share_driver_mode' for Generic
driver, because it now supports more than one mode.

TODO: add/update unit tests

Implements bp single-svm-mode-for-generic-driver

Change-Id: I4aa8e84659ae428c5155a81c2ff6aab710a7832e
"}, {'created': '2015-01-05 18:58:53.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Implement single SVM mode for Generic driver

"}, {'created': '2015-01-06 10:40:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix handling of share-networks with single_svm drivers

If we create share with share driver that is enabled with "single_svm" mode
and provide share network, entity of "share server" will be created and status
"ACTIVE" will be set to it, because driver's interface of share-server creation
will return "Ok".
So, raise error before share server creation if share network provided using
"single_svm" mode with any share driver.

Change-Id: I4aa8e84659ae428c5155a81c2ff6aab710a7832e
Closes-Bug: #1407923

commit_message:
Fix handling of share-networks with single_svm drivers

If we create share with share driver that is enabled with "single_svm" mode
and provide share network, entity of "share server" will be created and status
"ACTIVE" will be set to it, because driver's interface of share-server creation
will return "Ok".
So, raise error before share server creation if share network provided using
"single_svm" mode with any share driver.

Change-Id: I4aa8e84659ae428c5155a81c2ff6aab710a7832e
Closes-Bug: #1407923

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-07 21:47:40.000000000', 'message': 'Correct revoke-sudo to actually work

* jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml(revoke-sudo): Simplify the sudoers
include file deletion to not rely on a conditional check, and then
test that it actually worked. Previously, systems where
/etc/sudoers.d was non-world-readable caused it to be a silent
no-op.

Change-Id: Ie713482acbd454eeb58c3481e8b8820049daaab8
'}]
commit_message:
Correct revoke-sudo to actually work

* jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml(revoke-sudo): Simplify the sudoers
include file deletion to not rely on a conditional check, and then
test that it actually worked. Previously, systems where
/etc/sudoers.d was non-world-readable caused it to be a silent
no-op.

Change-Id: Ie713482acbd454eeb58c3481e8b8820049daaab8

commit_message:
Clear multi-line sections before adding lines

With multiline support for local.conf, the first line is created with
iniset, which will set *all* previous lines to the same thing, and then
subsequent lines will be added. Modify the multiline support to first
clear existing lines from the section.

This causes fatal errors with neutron.conf, which defines drivers with a bunch
of service_provider= options, and the current code ends up with the first
driver defined in local.conf being present twice.

Change-Id: If132a94e53545d9134859aa508da7b9819ede2f8

subject: Account for nested stack validation in ResourceGroup
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-07 21:12:09.000000000', 'message': 'Account for nested stack validation in ResourceGroup

Due to the changes in StackResource, no special validation is
needed in ResourceGroup anymore given that the parent class
validates the nested template and also therefore accounts for
0-count groups.

Partial-Bug: #1407100
Change-Id: I5e25425688481e1c1910278b32caa7d479aeb1f8
'}]
commit_message:
Account for nested stack validation in ResourceGroup

Due to the changes in StackResource, no special validation is
needed in ResourceGroup anymore given that the parent class
validates the nested template and also therefore accounts for
0-count groups.

Partial-Bug: #1407100
Change-Id: I5e25425688481e1c1910278b32caa7d479aeb1f8

commit_message:
Prevent user from accessing privileged files

Closes-bug: 1400966
Related to OSSA-2014-041
CVE-2014-9493

Change-Id: I869b88cfe1bb8237f24d1e058ee7aac64806e230
(cherry picked from commit 233a71022e0ee90ddacc05126a0bc7265c1ad166)

By setting this pbr option in setup.cfg, the doc build will fail in

commit_message:
Set pbr 'warnerrors' option for doc build

By setting this pbr option in setup.cfg, the doc build will fail in
case of any warnings or errors occur during the build process.

Change-Id: I5aa77eb9c45a12e7e4d467eebb90487709cbe197

[{'created': '2015-01-02 13:55:50.000000000', 'message': 'Drop the MysqlClusterUniquePart validation

Trying to use overcloud-without-mergepy currently fails with
a validation error around MysqlClusterUniquePart. This
works around the issue by temporarily dropping the validation.

Change-Id: If93945a2c3396b07b592d08efb1f66e11d6194dd
Partial-bug: #1405446

commit_message:
Drop the MysqlClusterUniquePart validation

Trying to use overcloud-without-mergepy currently fails with
a validation error around MysqlClusterUniquePart. This
works around the issue by temporarily dropping the validation.

Change-Id: If93945a2c3396b07b592d08efb1f66e11d6194dd
Partial-bug: #1405446

commit_message:
Import shade into openstack-infra

Shade is a library that contains all the various logic you need to use
OpenStack with the clouds Infra has encountered. It's currently being
used as the basis of the next generation of ansible modules and the
intent is to replace the direct python-*client calls in nodepool and
launch_node.

Change-Id: I14332c43cf12d46bd4472312e8edfa5760fc2f68

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-17 21:09:17.000000000', 'message': 'Do not use https for keystone v2 admin

When passing an SSL hostname for keystone v2 admin access, the code
assumes that v2 admin services will be https. However, that is not the
case and usually is avoided. Since v2 is frozen and will be deprecated
some day, adding SSL for this piece of it seems like extra work for
not much gain. So we just use http.

Change-Id: I9fe4f57dc39e709c8f7549913ac3b1ef1eec81b5
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use https for keystone v2 admin

When passing an SSL hostname for keystone v2 admin access, the code
assumes that v2 admin services will be https. However, that is not the
case and usually is avoided. Since v2 is frozen and will be deprecated
some day, adding SSL for this piece of it seems like extra work for
not much gain. So we just use http.

Change-Id: I9fe4f57dc39e709c8f7549913ac3b1ef1eec81b5

commit_message:
Add support for creating Keystone v3 clients

Due to the Keystone v2 client not supporting domains, we should add
support for using the Keystone v3 client for some operations. This
branch does not change any of the existing Keystone callsites, merely
adds support for creating the client.

Drive-by correcting the method name for the Neutron client tests.

commit_message:
Remove unused requirements

With the removal of keystone.openstack.common.gettextutils, Babel
is no longer used directly by Keystone.

Partial-Bug: #1408423

Change-Id: Ied54434f13e960b1ec99227e5fd8db95e7dcbad9

commit_message:
Pass Horizon port through to controller nodes

The Horizon port may vary based on SSL enablement, and needs
to be known by the nodes for the purpose of iptables rules, etc.

Change-Id: Iec475a6c245a5bfe8b1d63ff72b6d0299861615c

commit_message:
Don't log each received messages

oslo.utils.strutils.mask_password take too much time on
big payload (nova-conductor can receive payload ~ 66k in
largeops jobs for example).

This change removes this logging until we make mask_password
more efficient or we have a smarted the oslo.messaging logging to
not log everything.

Change-Id: Ib1f1d70c5cb820e8ff2de10e6064037808ea1f3a
Closes-bug: #1408362

[{'created': '2014-12-31 06:07:11.000000000', 'message': "Unshelving a volume backed instance doesn't work

In case of volume backed instance, snapshot is not
taken when an instance is shelved, so shelve_image_id
key is not set to the instance system metadata.
If shelve_image_id is None, then it shouldn't raise UnshelveException.

Closes-Bug: #1404801

commit_message:
Unshelving a volume backed instance doesn't work

In case of volume backed instance, snapshot is not
taken when an instance is shelved, so shelve_image_id
key is not set to the instance system metadata.
If shelve_image_id is None, then it shouldn't raise UnshelveException.

Closes-Bug: #1404801
Change-Id: I295e3e2b2c2d640684a5416c53fa1fed7e6297e2

Remove unused directory nova/tests/unit/bundle

Seems like a vestige from some test that was yanked out.

Change-Id: I0ff5990987e94a98825fdfa5200e0bf4a20f99b9

[{'created': '2014-12-24 16:35:37.000000000', 'message': 'Publish files for gate-rally-dsvm-cli job

gate-rally-dsvm-cli is functional testing gate for Rally CLI.
In many case we would like to see ouput of commands. This change
allow us to do that.

Change-Id: I50e63ad7adf6ad5d2348d7912ce0a99bb81b78d4

commit_message:
Publish files for gate-rally-dsvm-cli job

gate-rally-dsvm-cli is functional testing gate for Rally CLI.
In many case we would like to see ouput of commands. This change
allow us to do that.

Change-Id: I50e63ad7adf6ad5d2348d7912ce0a99bb81b78d4

commit_message:
Lower overcloud wait_for

We are currently waiting for 360 min for the overcloud to time out. This
is probably an unreasonable default but its also reasonable for us to
set this value in CI since we have a known timeout window before jenkins
kills our CI job.

Change-Id: I015143068fbf3f17cda3ac6a2bb87784b84cf127
Closes-Bug: #140781

commit_message:
Add networking-plumgrid project to StackForge

This repo will hold PLUMgrid drivers for Neutron.

The need of setting this repo up is inline with spec proposal [1], where core
elements of the Neutron project are decoupled by the internals of the
technology being supported.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/134680/

Change-Id: Ieb1efa910fff124fe30159cf7b5f394e91eff2c4

commit_message:
Adds retrieving large lists info to End User Guide

With the moving of the Object Storage API content from a
long-form dev guide to a specification, some topics needed
To be added to the End User Guide.

Change-Id: I0ee8366bc88985ba985518c8c014a03af6bdc05a
Partial-bug: 1392382

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-05 05:56:40.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unused function _get_flavor_refs in flavor_access extension

Function _get_flavor_refs never be used in any code, this patch is to remove it
in flavor_access extension for both v2 and v2.1 API.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ibbe91227e98b2ccddd1892ed43e54ac526fe7664
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unused function _get_flavor_refs in flavor_access extension

Function _get_flavor_refs never be used in any code, this patch is to remove it
in flavor_access extension for both v2 and v2.1 API.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ibbe91227e98b2ccddd1892ed43e54ac526fe7664

subject: VMware: make use of oslo.vmware logout

commit_message:
VMware: make use of oslo.vmware logout

Make use of the oslo.vmware method for logging out of an active
session instead of doing it via the session Vim.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ied5bc13840e2373f7d23cba784441aa2d02b7236

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-06 23:18:28.000000000', 'message': "Return floating_ip['fixed_ip']['instance_uuid'] from neutronv2 API

The os-floating-ips extension translates the floating IP information
from the network API for the response but is only checking fields based
on what comes back from nova-network, which is using the FloatingIP
object. The neutronv2 API returns a different set of keys for the
instance/instance_uuid which the API extension doesn't handle and
therefore doesn't show the associated instance id for a given floating
IP.

The network APIs should return consistent data formats so this change
adds the expected key to fix the bug in the API extension (since the API
extensions shouldn't have to know the implementation details of the
network API, there are some extensions actually checking if it's the
neutron API and parsing the result set based on that).

This change will be used to backport the fix to the stable branches.

The longer term fix is to convert the neutronv2 get_floating_ip* API
methods to use nova objects which will be done as part of blueprint
kilo-objects in a separate change.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to the test modules being
moved in Kilo, otherwise the code is the same.

Closes-Bug: #1380965

Change-Id: I01df2096ced51eb9ebfd994cf8397f2fa094f6e3
(cherry picked from commit 48c24dbb6bc1e55973dce2b8bc3e74105b0020ce)
"}]
commit_message:
Return floating_ip['fixed_ip']['instance_uuid'] from neutronv2 API

The os-floating-ips extension translates the floating IP information
from the network API for the response but is only checking fields based
on what comes back from nova-network, which is using the FloatingIP
object. The neutronv2 API returns a different set of keys for the
instance/instance_uuid which the API extension doesn't handle and
therefore doesn't show the associated instance id for a given floating
IP.

The network APIs should return consistent data formats so this change
adds the expected key to fix the bug in the API extension (since the API
extensions shouldn't have to know the implementation details of the
network API, there are some extensions actually checking if it's the
neutron API and parsing the result set based on that).

This change will be used to backport the fix to the stable branches.

The longer term fix is to convert the neutronv2 get_floating_ip* API
methods to use nova objects which will be done as part of blueprint
kilo-objects in a separate change.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to the test modules being
moved in Kilo, otherwise the code is the same.

Closes-Bug: #1380965

Change-Id: I01df2096ced51eb9ebfd994cf8397f2fa094f6e3
(cherry picked from commit 48c24dbb6bc1e55973dce2b8bc3e74105b0020ce)

Phil, not at all -- the idea is that the driver returns a sub-flow and we kick it off as part of our create listener/create amphora flow --

I a simple case it could just be a task but if the driver wants to break things into flows I am not gonna stop them.

For Doug - again I am open for using an abstraction layer to be not tied to taskflow.'}, {'account_id': 11302, 'date': '2014-12-22 19:05:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I only assumed that because its stated that the driver returns a task flow and not acts upon it. Misunderstanding about task flow is my issue'}, {'account_id': 11302, 'date': '2014-12-23 04:18:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Curious why drivers are tightly coupled with taskflow? Granted the manager will maintain the flows, but ultimately the logic is defined by the driver. With that in mind, say I wanted to communicate with my device through another protocol directly would I be able to return just a 'logging' flow of sorts? Or should the interface require me to return a flow, what if I return nothing? I may be thinking about this wrong, or this just isnt necessary. 

Maybe making the methods generic like update_amphora/loadbalancer/whatever and if a flow is returned then the manager can act appropriately, this would be my only suggestion if my thoughts above arent completely flawed."}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2014-12-23 16:53:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Phil, Doug also wants an abstraction layer so things aren't as tightly coupled with taskflow but this is still something which we need to investigate in code and not really in spec.

Overall task flow gives you the flexibility to define a rollback together with an execute (+ retries), so if we do something generic it would look like:

class OctaviaTask:
  def rollback():
      pass;
  
  def execute():
     #do stuff

I don't think it's too onerous to make plugin developers to wrap their code that way --"}, {'account_id': 11302, 'date': '2014-12-23 16:58:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Fair enough, Im not really against this at all, guess my confusion or concern is on the interface method names as they suggest that I must return flows regardless of my drivers underlying behaviour. Though, on the other hand, I'm not writing one of those 'other' drivers and am totally content with this. 

Thank you for the replies!"}, {'account_id': 6951, 'date': '2014-12-27 00:47:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Since this seems to be the way we're creating our drivers, and most agree, this follows with that.

German, I do believe this will become onerous for driver writers because they have to learn how to use taskflow.  How taskflow passes parameters from task to task, how you provide results, setting up flows, etc.  Whereas with a an interface that knows nothing about taskflow (or any other task execution library), it becomes just writing simple python.

Since we're not planning on many implementations of this in the beginning, I'm not fighting this strongly.  I am complaining though, obviously."}, {'account_id': 10980, 'date': '2014-12-30 18:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-12-30 18:49:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Verified

commit_message:
updates the amphora driver interface spec

with the lastest from the midcycle
* remove getHealth, getStats
* add getConfiguration
* remove some unneeded exceptions
* make several calls return task flow
  flows

Change-Id: I6a11fac73a696f23f7c4df7410f66ecdd9fcf50e

commit_message:
Prevent user from accessing privileged files

Closes-bug: 1400966
Related to OSSA-2014-041
CVE-2014-9493

Change-Id: I869b88cfe1bb8237f24d1e058ee7aac64806e230

commit_message:
use LOG instead of logger as name for the Logger object

Replaced all appearances of 'logger' with 'LOG' to unify
the name of the Logger object.

Also replaced all imports of logging with
glance.openstack.common.log and moved the logger initialization
in glance/common/config.py into the global scope.

Change-Id: Iacf926fc98d009e580e1a8d83bbd6576685625b4

commit_message:
Enable --os-insecure CLI option

--os-insecure is not correctly passed to Keystoneclient because it
expects a bool type but we assgin a string value to the insecure
parameter, this patch fixes it by using oslo.utils.strutils.bool_from_string.

--os-insecure is ignored by Ceilometerclient.v2.client because it
expects parameter verify rather than insecure, this patch fixes it
by converting insecure to verify if that field is not set.

Change-Id: I545de167cdf8cfec6b5c67984b74327fb76c513a
Closes-Bug: #1394449

commit_message:

unused or available as a fixture. Remove that copied data and use the
fixture.

Ken, looking good so far, i'm a little concerned about sahara storing another password in the database but i'm not sure there is a better way around this.

just to help me understand how it's used, could you describe the how the password generated in db_helper is used by the cloudera plugin?"}, {'account_id': 8411, 'date': '2014-12-15 23:43:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7125, 'date': '2014-12-17 13:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13662, 'date': '2014-12-18 13:12:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Michael, the passwd generated in db_helper, like get_hive_db_password, will generate a password and store this password in sahara conductor cluster info. Later, during cluster creating, this password will be used to configure the hive service created in cdh plugin.
In db_helpler.create_hive_database method, this password will also be used to create a metastore db (named "metastore" by default) in cluster, and hive will store metadata in this db (by user "hive" by default, and the generated password).'}, {'account_id': 10670, 'date': '2014-12-18 21:29:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

thanks for the clarification Ken'}, {'account_id': 13662, 'date': '2014-12-19 01:46:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I found the ci-test fail might be because of the flavor size. In my local tests, if I use flavor 3 (m1.medium, 4GB RAM), the tests never fail. However, if I use flavor 2 (m1.small, 2GB RAM), the tests often hit outofmemory issue and only a few times can succeed. Maybe adding more packages required higher memory size. Is there any possibility that changing the ci-test to use larger memory size, like 4GB?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-12-23 09:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

commit_message:
Enable more services in CDH plugin

We add more services support in CDH plugin, including Flume, Key-Value
Store Indexer, Sentry, SOLR, SQOOP, and Impala.

implements bp:add-cdh-more-services

Change-Id: I4262810026b0d65ef195829549f8c99bdfe94c2f

[{'created': '2015-01-06 14:52:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix neutron hang for IPv6 allocation pool update

While rebuilding IPAllocationPools, Neutron is using netaddr.iter_iprange
(a generator that produces IPAddress objects). For an IPv6 subnet, this is
a costly operation and is causing Neutron Server to hang. This patch
addresses the issue by replacing netaddr.iter_iprange with netaddr.IPRange
which provides the same functionality while calculating the IPSets.

Closes-Bug: #1401751
Change-Id: I2287e5348aab82e39cf1b6e2884d08237a09b06d
(cherry picked from commit b38f1bfa7b4f662182f552530b43301b214baa8d)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron hang for IPv6 allocation pool update

While rebuilding IPAllocationPools, Neutron is using netaddr.iter_iprange
(a generator that produces IPAddress objects). For an IPv6 subnet, this is
a costly operation and is causing Neutron Server to hang. This patch
addresses the issue by replacing netaddr.iter_iprange with netaddr.IPRange
which provides the same functionality while calculating the IPSets.

Closes-Bug: #1401751
Change-Id: I2287e5348aab82e39cf1b6e2884d08237a09b06d
(cherry picked from commit b38f1bfa7b4f662182f552530b43301b214baa8d)

(2 comments)

I'm thinking we might still want to keep the enable_service()/disable_service() concept with these plugins, without it ti becomes a separate check for other services to see if an optional service is present.

For example, gluster and ceph probably don't get along and maybe there should be sanity checks in both plugins looking fro the other one enabled.

commit_message:
Implement devstack external plugins

This is an initial pass at plugin infrastructure for devstack which
allows specifying an external repository via:

enable_plugin <name> <giturl> [branch]

It implements the devstack specification for this at
I173dee3d57967b1d2ffd30e4868a2832aeac97ce

Change-Id: I8e4175313b3cf0b12e981122358b1288a7eb0746

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-03 06:49:09.000000000', 'message': 'Move resource filtering logic to a common place

Closes-Bug: 1364758
Change-Id: Ie9dbb50b79c042e49ef7eaba831280e175cc1e7f
'}, {'created': '2014-09-05 09:07:08.000000000', 'message': "Move metadata filtering logic to utils.py

Metadata filtering logic in it's current form is tightly coupled with compute
code. To make this filtering logic usable for filtering metadata of other
resources, it is being moved to utils.py file. The filtering metadata logic
is going to be used for filtering volume and volume snapshot metadata in the
EC2 API, at the very least.

There were no unit tests present at all to test the filtering logic. Those
have been added too, and in the process of writing unit tests, a bug was found
and fixed too, in this patch.

Closes-Bug: 1364758
Closes-Bug: 1365887
Change-Id: Ie9dbb50b79c042e49ef7eaba831280e175cc1e7f
"}, {'created': '2014-09-05 11:52:38.000000000', 'message': "Move metadata filtering logic to utils.py

commit_message:
Move metadata filtering logic to utils.py

Metadata filtering logic in it's current form is tightly coupled with
compute code. To make this filtering logic usable for filtering
metadata of other resources, it is being moved to utils.py file. The
filtering metadata logic is going to be used for filtering volume and
volume snapshot metadata in the EC2 API, at the very least.

There were no unit tests present at all to test the filtering logic.
Those have been added too, and in the process of writing unit tests,
a bug was found: a single character value of a resource metadata
(e.g. 'c') matches when a filter is specified which contains
that character as a part of input matching string (e.g.
all resources which has a metadata value = 'taco')

The bug has also been fixed, and accompanying testcase added

Closes-Bug: 1364758
Closes-Bug: 1365887
Change-Id: Ie9dbb50b79c042e49ef7eaba831280e175cc1e7f

commit_message:
Fix passing an object url to the heat CLI

Make a wrapper around the raw_request function so that it correctly
returns a string rather than a requests.Response object to match
the required API.

Closes-Bug: #1408199
Change-Id: Ic497d952ede7500d3787495865440befd0a92c0a

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow

(1 comment)

Thanks, Adrien.  The patch looks much better now, but I don't agree that current implemetation - suggest deployer to change Nova policy, is a good idea.  We'd just use a admin role to do the query."}, {'account_id': 12561, 'date': '2014-10-09 14:30:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Another way to achieve "instance locality" without having to change Nova policy is to configure a Nova admin account into Cinder conf.  Therefore, the cinder.compute.nova.novaclient() would be modified to use admin credentials when admin=True is passed (currently it just uses the admin endpoint, with regular user credentials).

This requires to add `nova_admin_user` and `nova_admin_password` options in cinder.conf.

Can you tell me what you think?'}, {'account_id': 12561, 'date': '2014-10-29 13:12:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 12561, 'date': '2014-10-29 13:21:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Changes:

Now uses a Nova admin account (set in Cinder conf) to query instance info, so modifying Nova policy is not necessary anymore.

Add timeouts. In case Nova API is down, don't wait indefinitely but fail with an APITimeout exception.

Check that the scheduler isn't affected by the Nova API state when the hint is not used."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-10-29 14:24:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Verified-1

Is this change really required? Not able to understand if our existing infrastructure can handle this situation of host local scenario by specifying a volume type with specs matching local host.

Can you explain more use cases when this change does more than simply configuring a matching volume type an using it?'}, {'account_id': 12561, 'date': '2014-11-05 11:49:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Hi Navneet, thank you for reviewing.

As far as I know, volume types are created by admins. To achieve instance-local volumes, admins should create volumes type for each cinder backend, and final users should be aware of that.

The functionality added by this filter is quite different: it allows users to create volumes on the same host as an instance. No admin action is required, no volume type has to be set up, and most of all the user doesn't have any knowledge of the infra (having a volume type per hypervisor would give the final user big clues on how the infra is set up)."}, {'account_id': 6094, 'date': '2014-11-05 12:33:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Adrien, I see the result you want to achieve but I have some basic questions:

1. Why should the end user be allowed to know whats the infrastructure set up? Its neither desired nor mandatory for him to now the backend details.

2. End users need a specific infrastructure service and its admins job to see that his needs are met. This can be handled by either the qos support or volume type. Setting up infrastructure or configuring it is not to be handled by end user.

3. This change also provides a risk when the storage on local infrastructure may run out because end user is creating storage on same servers hosting nova and cinder.

In my view the quality of service is what end user needs to worry and not infrastructure support or configuration. I think this change is violating the service model and leaking in with admin role job.'}, {'account_id': 12561, 'date': '2014-11-05 13:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Navneet, I think there is a misunderstanding here.

1 & 2. The end user should NOT be aware of the infrastructure set up. Neither should him/her have to configure anything. This filter is made to hide the back-end details to the end user, by using an admin role (within Cinder) that the user is not aware of. In the scheduler hint, user pass the instance UUID, not the back-end where it is, because he/she is not supposed to know anything about back-ends.

3. This filter provides an optional feature to have locally-attached volumes, to enhance io performance. Deployers can choose if they want to make it available to end users, and users are free to use it or not. If storage is running out on a physical host, user can still take the hint out of the query and everything will work as usual.

I hope this answers your questions, please tell me if I misunderstood your point.'}, {'account_id': 9366, 'date': '2014-11-05 13:52:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6094, 'date': '2014-11-06 12:19:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Adrien, IMO the qos or volume type capability should be used instead to achieve the particular type of service. Whether its given out of the same box nova/cinder resides is admin's will or configuration and not end user's choice. using the qos/volume type gives more options/control to the scheduler to choose a backend which can fulfill the request then relying on a blanket capacity/performance of storage on local system. 

Cinder core can decide on the necessity of this feature, but for me this feature is not required. Sorry for -1."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-11-20 02:25:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 2792, 'date': '2014-11-21 12:51:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1

Just my 0.01c here. This topic was brought up a number of times this far (e.g. here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/66737/) , so obviously there is a bunch of users having an actual *need* to start VMs that can access their storage locally. The obvious reason for this, as already explained by Adrien, is the ability to run a high-IOPS VM. Any kind of network storage will not be able to deliver decent IOPS values for single-threaded applications such as MySQL as they will all suffer massively from the latency introduced by the network itself. The only way to work around this is to start a VM that will actually access its storage locally. So pretty please please please merge this already.'}, {'account_id': 12561, 'date': '2014-11-26 13:20:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-11-26 14:05:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Verified-1

(1 comment)

One question inline.

This does seem to be reasonable code, and there is a clear desire for it. While I think it is slightly disingenuous to say the high iop rates /can't / be obtained by network storage, putting a bunch of SSD in every compute node might well make more sense for some deployments.

I think a filter in nova to put the instance on nodes that have local storage available in this manor might be needed too, but that is a deployment issue, I think the code is already in nova to do that.

All in all, seems like a reasonable patch. Several places I think it could go in future, but it solves a core need in its current form and nothing in the design seems to preclude improvements in future.

By requiring that cinder-volume runs on (all or a subset of) compute nodes, you avoid the problems of snapshots, remote attach etc not working, which is good."}, {'account_id': 10621, 'date': '2014-11-27 11:28:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-02 11:34:33.000000000', 'message': "Add a data locality filter

The term data locality here refers to having an instance and an attached
volume on the same physical host.  This can be desirable in some
configurations, in order to improve disk throughput and reduce latency.
In order to work, physical hosts should run both nova-compute and
cinder-volume services.

This change adds a filter to Cinder: InstanceLocalFilter.  When using
this filter, a user can request the creation of volumes 'local' to a
specified instance, without any knowledge of the underlying
infrastructure or back-ends.

Please note that this filter can allow multiple Cinder hosts to match,
since multiple back-ends can co-exist on the same physical host.

For example:
  Instance identified by INSTANCE-UUID is running in a hypervisor
  running on the HOST1 physical host.

  To create a volume in a back-end hosted by HOST1:
    cinder create --hint local_to_instance=INSTANCE-UUID SIZE

Change-Id: Id428fa2132c1afed424443083645787ee3cb0399

"}, {'created': '2014-09-16 15:02:22.000000000', 'message': "Add an instance locality filter

Having an instance and an attached volume on the same physical host
(i.e. data locality) can be desirable in some configurations, in order
to improve disk throughput and reduce latency.

This change adds a filter to Cinder: InstanceLocalityFilter.  When using
this filter, a user can request the creation of volumes 'local' to a
specified instance, without specifying the hypervisor's hostname, and
without any knowledge of the underlying back-ends.

In order to work, physical hosts should run both nova-compute and
cinder-volume services.  Also, this filter relies on Nova's Extended
Server Attributes extension, so the calling user should have the right
to use this extension (either being admin or authorized by Nova's policy
in the 'extended_server_attributes' property).

For example:
  Instance identified by INSTANCE-UUID is running in a hypervisor
  running on the HOST1 physical host.

  To create a volume in a back-end hosted by HOST1:
    cinder create --hint local_to_instance=INSTANCE-UUID SIZE

DocImpact

Change-Id: Id428fa2132c1afed424443083645787ee3cb0399

"}, {'created': '2014-10-29 13:12:59.000000000', 'message': "Add an instance-locality filter

Having an instance and an attached volume on the same physical host
(i.e. data locality) can be desirable in some configurations, in order
to improve disk throughput and reduce latency.

This patch adds an InstanceLocalityFilter filter that allow users to
request creation of volumes 'local' to an existing instance, without
specifying the hypervisor's hostname, and without any knowledge of the
underlying back-ends.

In order to work:
- At least one physical host should run both nova-compute and
  cinder-volume services.
- The Extended Server Attributes extension needs to be active in Nova
  (this is by default), so that the 'OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:hypervisor_hostname'
  property is returned when requesting instance info.
- The user making the call needs to have sufficient rights for the property
  to be returned by Nova. This can be achieved either by changing Nova's
  policy.json (the 'extended_server_attributes' option), or by setting a
  Nova admin account in Cinder's conf.

For example:
  Instance identified by INSTANCE-UUID is running in a hypervisor
  running on the HOST1 physical host.

  To create a 42 GB volume in a back-end hosted by HOST1:
    cinder create --hint local_to_instance=INSTANCE-UUID 42

DocImpact

Change-Id: Id428fa2132c1afed424443083645787ee3cb0399

This patch adds an InstanceLocalityFilter filter that allow users to

underlying back-ends.

In order to work:
- At least one physical host should run both nova-compute and
  cinder-volume services.
- The Extended Server Attributes extension needs to be active in Nova
  (this is by default), so that the 'OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host' property is
  returned when requesting instance info.
- The user making the call needs to have sufficient rights for the property
  to be returned by Nova. This can be achieved either by changing Nova's
  policy.json (the 'extended_server_attributes' option), or by setting
  an account with admin role in Cinder conf.

For example:
  Instance 01234567-89ab-cdef is running in a hypervisor on the physical
  host 'my-host'.

  To create a 42 GB volume in a back-end hosted by 'my-host':
    cinder create --hint local_to_instance=01234567-89ab-cdef 42

DocImpact

"}, {'created': '2014-12-05 15:20:06.000000000', 'message': "Add an instance-locality filter

Having an instance and an attached volume on the same physical host
(i.e. data locality) can be desirable in some configurations, in order
to achieve high-performance disk I/O.

This patch adds an InstanceLocalityFilter filter that allow users to
request creation of volumes 'local' to an existing instance, without
specifying the hypervisor's hostname, and without any knowledge of the
underlying back-ends.

In order to work:
- At least one physical host should run both nova-compute and
  cinder-volume services.
- The Extended Server Attributes extension needs to be active in Nova
  (this is by default), so that the 'OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host' property is
  returned when requesting instance info.
- The user making the call needs to have sufficient rights for the
  property to be returned by Nova. This can be achieved either by
  changing Nova's policy.json (the 'extended_server_attributes' option),
  or by setting an account with privileged rights in Cinder conf.

For example:
  Instance 01234567-89ab-cdef is running in a hypervisor on the physical
  host 'my-host'.

  To create a 42 GB volume in a back-end hosted by 'my-host':
    cinder create --hint local_to_instance=01234567-89ab-cdef 42

DocImpact: New Cinder scheduler filter
Change-Id: Id428fa2132c1afed424443083645787ee3cb0399

"}, {'created': '2014-12-20 10:07:47.000000000', 'message': "Add an instance-locality filter

Having an instance and an attached volume on the same physical host
(i.e. data locality) can be desirable in some configurations, in order
to achieve high-performance disk I/O.

This patch adds an InstanceLocalityFilter filter that allow users to
request creation of volumes 'local' to an existing instance, without
specifying the hypervisor's hostname, and without any knowledge of the
underlying back-ends.

In order to work:
- At least one physical host should run both nova-compute and
  cinder-volume services.
- The Extended Server Attributes extension needs to be active in Nova
  (this is by default), so that the 'OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host' property is
  returned when requesting instance info.
- The user making the call needs to have sufficient rights for the
  property to be returned by Nova. This can be achieved either by
  changing Nova's policy.json (the 'extended_server_attributes' option),
  or by setting an account with privileged rights in Cinder conf.

For example:
  Instance 01234567-89ab-cdef is running in a hypervisor on the physical
  host 'my-host'.

  To create a 42 GB volume in a back-end hosted by 'my-host':
    cinder create --hint local_to_instance=01234567-89ab-cdef 42

DocImpact: New Cinder scheduler filter
Change-Id: Id428fa2132c1afed424443083645787ee3cb0399

commit_message:
Add an instance-locality filter

Having an instance and an attached volume on the same physical host
(i.e. data locality) can be desirable in some configurations, in order
to achieve high-performance disk I/O.

This patch adds an InstanceLocalityFilter filter that allow users to
request creation of volumes 'local' to an existing instance, without
specifying the hypervisor's hostname, and without any knowledge of the
underlying back-ends.

In order to work:
- At least one physical host should run both nova-compute and
  cinder-volume services.
- The Extended Server Attributes extension needs to be active in Nova
  (this is by default), so that the 'OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host' property is
  returned when requesting instance info.
- The user making the call needs to have sufficient rights for the
  property to be returned by Nova. This can be achieved either by
  changing Nova's policy.json (the 'extended_server_attributes' option),
  or by setting an account with privileged rights in Cinder conf.

For example:
  Instance 01234567-89ab-cdef is running in a hypervisor on the physical
  host 'my-host'.

  To create a 42 GB volume in a back-end hosted by 'my-host':
    cinder create --hint local_to_instance=01234567-89ab-cdef 42

Note:
  Currently it is not recommended to allow instance migrations for
  hypervisors where this hint will be used. In case of instance
  migration, a previously locally-created volume will not be
  automatically migrated. Also in case of instance migration during the
  volume's scheduling, the result is unpredictable.

DocImpact: New Cinder scheduler filter
Change-Id: Id428fa2132c1afed424443083645787ee3cb0399

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-07 13:29:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix documentation build

manila/share/drivers/emc/plugins/registry.py was removed which leads to:

ImportError: No module named registry

while generating the documentation.

Change-Id: I3527e6bd37f56e5b1cbae0bdccd64487871ea560
'}]
commit_message:
Fix documentation build

manila/share/drivers/emc/plugins/registry.py was removed which leads to:

ImportError: No module named registry

while generating the documentation.

Change-Id: I3527e6bd37f56e5b1cbae0bdccd64487871ea560

commit_message:
Updated wsgi file from openstack/keystone.

The current wsgi file does not work with
icehouse. The file has been updated from
the openstack keystone repository.

Change-Id: I2c39a6e682e3cff799b1072609c327bf338616d5

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-06 17:01:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add undocumented options to keystoneauth sample config

Adds is_admin and allow_overrides to the keystoneauth section
of proxy-server.conf.sample and also adds related comments to
the keystoneauth docstring.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I7c751880cb6742db7347f31c4d32b523e33da75b
'}]
commit_message:
Add undocumented options to keystoneauth sample config

Adds is_admin and allow_overrides to the keystoneauth section
of proxy-server.conf.sample and also adds related comments to
the keystoneauth docstring.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I7c751880cb6742db7347f31c4d32b523e33da75b

Remove dependency oslo-incubator.middleware.request_id

openstack.common.middleware should be removed.

commit_message:
Configure disks for hp cloud instances

Nodepool sometimes provides an hp cloud instance that has the majority
of space in /dev/vdb which is mounted at /mnt. This patch repurposes
that partition as an lvm VG for containers.

Also:
 * creates an LV for /opt and mounts that.
 * outputs some instance info that may be useful for debugging

Closes-Bug: #1407647

Change-Id: I91a6ab3994be348b17caaf9c9200d84463076d87

commit_message:
Zones prematurely marked ACTIVE

*Delays making a choice on zone status until after create_domain
method unless it's certain. A delayed poll or periodic sync will
mark the zone ACTIVE
*Adds a couple checks on errors to make sure a zone that never
successfully transferred is marked ERROR

Change-Id: Iabda1f2e0abf726faa74853f6b85e57d15f99a08
Closes-Bug: 1404377

commit_message:
Plugin contract changes for the certificate-order-api

This patch adds the plugin contract changes and code needed
to pass the new cert request types to the plugins.

Note that this is different from the blueprint - in that we
now introduce a supported_request_types() method, and we no longer use separate
API calls to distinguish between types.

Missing logic in some functions is expected to be filled in
in subsequent patches.

Change-Id: If4810b5e96ade5255d7886eb9480157329380b97
Implements: blueprint certificate-order-api

commit_message:
storage: change create_metric() to accept ArchivePolicy as argument

This should simplify the prototype of create_metric() and allow other
components than gnocchi.rest to create metric properly.

Change-Id: I1c0586bdef88c68e045a5a66d14418c710d1f241

Change-Id: If80a31beca54ac4193b7b72b8c49c928b18d356f

commit_message:
Fix TypeError in tempest retry functionality

When we get error with share creation and retry is enabled log message
is combined. But formatting was with mistake. It expected named/mapped
formating but got positioned formatting.

Change-Id: If80a31beca54ac4193b7b72b8c49c928b18d356f
Closes-Bug: #1408069

[{'created': '2014-09-09 15:43:57.000000000', 'message': "Ensure reliable cleanup of resources

Pacemaker for some unknown reasons fails to
cleanup errors in some conditions and doesn't
perform required operations.
This patch adds duplicate cleanups.

Closes-Bug: 1367340
Change-Id: I68c8eda5fa0b527764e2ad65bc0979cc2e5a47d4
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure reliable cleanup of resources

Pacemaker for some unknown reasons fails to
cleanup errors in some conditions and doesn't
perform required operations.
This patch adds duplicate cleanups.

Closes-Bug: 1367340
Change-Id: I68c8eda5fa0b527764e2ad65bc0979cc2e5a47d4

[{'created': '2015-01-06 20:54:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add created_at and updated_at to assembly

Expose the created_at and updated_at fields of assembly
objects, sorting by updated_at field. This puts the oldest
assemblies on the top of the list due to how cliutils
print_list orders rows.

Change-Id: I557c56916b13ca58104314e421e4f25fbf47a4a3
'}]
commit_message:
Add created_at and updated_at to assembly

Expose the created_at and updated_at fields of assembly
objects, sorting by updated_at field. This puts the oldest
assemblies on the top of the list due to how cliutils
print_list orders rows.

Change-Id: I557c56916b13ca58104314e421e4f25fbf47a4a3

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-02 12:16:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix concurrency getting share network in Tempest

In CI Tempest jobs we get error "share network not found" from time to time.
Cause for it was in improper usage of networks for isolated creds, that were
deleting share networks but did not create/use separate networks.
So, concurrent test suites were taken share network that becomes deleted by
another test suite within "cleanup" operation.

Make isolated creds use separate networks and delete such separate networks
in cleanup. It will make concurrent test suites with and without isolated creds
use different share networks.

Change-Id: I26194e77dfb0c6e303772d5924f0a0f512a48cda
Closes-Bug: #1406655
'}, {'created': '2015-01-02 15:46:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix concurrency getting share network in Tempest

In CI Tempest jobs we get error "share network not found" from time to time.
Cause for it was in improper usage of networks for isolated creds, that were
deleting share networks but did not use separate networks.
So, concurrent test suites were taken share network that becomes deleted by
another test suite within "cleanup" operation.

Make isolated creds use separate networks. It will make concurrent test suites
with and without isolated creds use different share networks.

Remove usage of external lock for method "provide_share_network" for tests
that use isolated creds.

Change-Id: I26194e77dfb0c6e303772d5924f0a0f512a48cda
Closes-Bug: #1406655
'}, {'created': '2015-01-02 15:49:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix concurrency getting share network in Tempest

that use isolated creds.

Change-Id: I26194e77dfb0c6e303772d5924f0a0f512a48cda

Cause for it was in improper usage of networks for isolated creds, that were

commit_message:
Fix concurrency problem in getting share network in Tempest

In CI Tempest jobs we get error "share network not found" from time to time.
Cause for it was improper usage of networks for isolated creds, that were
deleting share networks but did not use separate networks.
So, concurrent test suites were taking share network that became deleted by
another test suite within "cleanup" operation.

Make isolated creds use separate networks. It will make concurrent test suites
with and without isolated creds use different share networks.

Remove usage of external lock for method "provide_share_network" for tests
that use isolated creds.

Change-Id: I26194e77dfb0c6e303772d5924f0a0f512a48cda
Closes-Bug: #1406655

commit_message:
Make it possible to update tempest conf in all CI Tempest jobs

For the moment bash function 'iniset' is imported from devstack only for
multi backend Tempest job. It causes absence of set options for single backend
installation, because absent function 'iniset' is attempted to be used.

Due to described problem single backend installation does not have enabled
error suppressing in resource cleanup and retry mechanism is disabled.

Change-Id: Ib79be4c6b781e7c9e000dcea617cc8b03e5b4e7a

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/82/126582/2/check/noop/252a00c : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2014-10-09 20:13:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

So this is a very "hands-off" approach to the TC's mission, which I respect and think is probably at the right end of the spectrum. The TC definitely needs to do more advising IMHO.

I think it will still need to do some judging though. e.g. I'm not sure that we want to open up to all comers. Surely it's not unreasonable to limit access to projects where it is win-win. For example by limiting ourselves to Python projects that are all testable in the same way &c., we can offer projects a really useful set of infrastructure, and in return receive contributions from them to it that benefit everyone. Win-win. By contrast if a Java project, say, wanted to join then we wouldn't have very much to contribute to them (other than the name OpenStack), and nor would they to us. Not to suggest those projects aren't valuable, but we don't have to be responsible for every cloud-related project in the world.

I totally agree that the line is not drawn in the right place at the moment, but I think we probably still need a line somewhere.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2014-10-10 09:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2014-10-13 15:10:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:
