(1 comment)

I think we're going to have to do something much more cleaver if we want handoffs to get the indexes of the nodes that fell out when connecting to primaries - and I *think* we want handoffs to get the indexes of nodes that fell off when connecting to primaries?  If I'm using a replica count of 9 for my 6 and 3 scheme I should never see a X-Object-Sysmet-Ec-Archive-Index: 11 right?

Also, since index really only makes sense on the primary nodes I wanted to see how much cleaner it'd be to just add the indexes in the node dict when pulling them out of the the ring [1] - and it turns out to be a *lot* cleaner, really the only collateral test damage is in test_ring.TestRing.test_get_nodes.

But sam pointed out that node error limiting tries to use the node dicts to keep track of stuff - but since I seem keen on pursuing it - I'ma hafta pull that out into a data structure that's explicitly shared - which seems reasonable anyway.

Before I get on that though I want to try and see where we need to get at things to do the right stuff with handoffs... assuming I know what the right thing is?

1. https://gist.github.com/clayg/d004ae449b315150fa19"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2014-11-13 02:50:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I'm still researching the handoff indexing when I came across some code that seemed to be trying to do what I wanted - so maybe I missed something.

Maybe I should take a step back and veryify the index assignment on handoffs when I shutdown some nodes.

Probably wouldn't hurt to get some tests to cover the index assignment too - or at least identify some likely candidates that we could crib."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2014-11-13 03:01:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

yeah definitely seeing handoffs getting indexes above the number of replicas - but maybe that's just cause they're sending the wrong trailing metadata - and the chunks are actually correct.  Is there something I could script up with pyeclib where I gould give it FA on disk and have it read the headers or something to tell me what it thinks the index is?"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2014-11-13 03:04:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

seems like this would help with that problem:

diff --git a/swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py b/swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py
index 9e0c0f9..331a288 100644
--- a/swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py
+++ b/swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py
@@ -1023,7 +1023,7 @@ class ObjectController(Controller):
                             for putter in putters:
                                 trail_md = policy.trailing_metadata(
                                     etag_hasher, bytes_transferred,
-                                    putter.index)
+                                    chunk_index[putter])
                                 if not policy.stores_objects_verbatim:
                                     trail_md['Etag'] = chunk_hashers[
                                         putter.hshr_index].hexdigest()"}, {'account_id': 7479, 'date': '2014-11-14 16:11:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

thanks clay - man whatever they're paying you its not enough :)  I'll pull in that change and poke on it a bit.  What specific test case (series of steps like I'm in kindergarten please) where you running when you saw the bogus index?  Wrt the pyeclib question I'll ping tsg later today, not sure off the top of my head...."}, {'account_id': 7479, 'date': '2014-11-14 16:20:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

hell's bells, that's a total bug that I introduced when laying Sam's old code on top of the new stuff....will fix"}, {'account_id': 7479, 'date': '2014-11-14 16:56:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-11-14 18:45:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

looks good!'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2014-12-12 23:52:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

sorry I don't have more time to offer code at the moment - maybe next week.  but ultimate I don't think we want/need to change the iter node interface to include indexes, we can just put the indexes of primary nodes in the node dicts [1] now that the node dicts aren't being relied on for error limiting thanks to sam's other patch.

If you don't end up doing this because you're working on other stuff that's fine, but I also have some other stuff I'm working on unrelated to ec that will consume some of my time next week as well.  We'll have an oppertunity on Friday to regroup and figure out how to get everyone re-oriented.

There's also some other upstream patches on the priority review page that keep popping up - additional eyes there could relieve some of the review burden so sam and I can focus on writing ec code as well.

Sorry.

1. https://gist.github.com/clayg/d004ae449b315150fa19"}, {'account_id': 5189, 'date': '2014-12-15 14:31:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

@Clay, do you mean sth like this? I drafted some code here: https://gist.github.com/zhouyuan/3f6706479384dde0be9b'}, {'account_id': 7479, 'date': '2014-12-15 19:43:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thanks for looking at this!  Can you just push your proposal on this patch?'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2014-12-15 21:37:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

yuan, yeah something like that - i'm not really sure how to index handoffs, exactly, it doesn't really matter what order they come out of the ring with - I think we just assign the first successful handoff connection the first hole?

On GET we're never going to be able to trust the node_iter index anyway I think - and pyeclib doesn't really care what order you hand fragment indexes back in.

Anyway, I've got a few other irons in the fire this week - so like Paul says we can just push over here and what we can get working..."}, {'account_id': 5189, 'date': '2014-12-16 03:57:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-12-16 06:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified-1

commit_message:
Add node/pair index patch back into feature/EC

It was in, it was out, now its back in.  This was not done
automagically via git based on changes that have been made
since it was last added its sorta hand stitched from
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/114084/3

and therefore needs real review.

Co-Authored-By: Samuel Merritt <sam@swiftstack.com>
Co-Authored-By: Yuan Zhou <dunk007@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I154cc32886c74c962ac30fcbc00ca6949c955903

commit_message:
add conntrack in neutron-router element

neutron l3 agent will remove conntrack rules after floating ip is
disassociated from a VM, but now neutron-router element is missing
the conntrack executable to delete the rules.
also add it in package-install in case vendor distro package doesn't
specify conntrack as a dependency.
move arping package declaration into package-installs.yaml altogether
within this patch.

Change-Id: Ib517907c23f142ec8c063dc6c571ce2e8494fa14
Closes-bug: #1405370

commit_message:
Tweak gate hooks scripts to handle both functional and api jobs

With this change both the API and Functional job will benefit
from the use of gate hooks. This is especially useful to make
the API job emit the test results the same way other jobs do.

NOTE: Changes are applied to both contrib directories under
neutron/tests and neutron/tests/functional; these two directories
are supposed to be in sync until change [1] merges, after which
we can drop neutron/tests/functional/contrib, in favor of
neutron/tests/contrib. This was done because of the symlink issue
caused by [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/142603/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/143152/

Change-Id: I0b823b17d6317e9409fd9b5872c5f4674c1b6824

(12 comments)

My initial feedback inline.

The following points need to be considered:

- Increment RPC API version appropriately for both server-to-agent and agent-to-server to allow rolling upgrade.
- RPC API from agent-to-server is now backward *incompatible*. It should be backward-compatible, i.e., the old version of agent and the new version of neutron-server should work and vise versa.
- It changes agent/rpc PluginRpcApiMixin which is used in various agents, so we need to investigate the impact to plugins other than ML2 plugins. At a glance, tunnel_sync is used only by ovs-agent and ofa-agent and it seems safe but more careful review is required.

In addition, tunnel_delete from server to agent is beyond the scope of this bug. Can we improve or fix this in a separate patch?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2014-09-25 10:57:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(5 comments)

Hi Akihiro,

I think I have addressed most of your review comment but I need your help/suggestion to address this 

"Changing tunnel_type to tunnel_types is a backward-incompatible change, You need to ensure the old and new version of RPC work at the same time to allow rolling-upgrade."

Also to delete the stale flows,ports on br-tun we need to have tunnel_delete rpc. Simply deleting from neutron_db will not make any sense.

Thanks for all your review comments :)

Request all reviewers to review latest patch set.'}, {'account_id': 1923, 'date': '2014-09-25 17:05:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Hi All, 

I have completed the functionality to cover following cases:

1. If a passed host is found, update IP address if different.
2. If a passed host is not found and a passed IP address is found, set the passed host to "host" column.(upgrade case)
3. If both are not found, it is a new endpoint.
4. If host is not passed from an agent, it is a legacy mode.

Also, I have done lot of code refactoring especially moved common test cases from test_type_vxlan.py to test_type_tunnel.py.

I request reviewers to review it and post there fruitful comments.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-10-14 00:51:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Verified-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-12 07:13:39.000000000', 'message': "Stale VXLAN and GRE tunnel port deletion

Description:
Stale GRE and VXLAN tunnel endpoints persists in neutron db this should be
deleted from the database. Also, if local_ip of CN or NN changes the
stale tunnel ports and flows persists on br-tun on other CN's and NN's
for that remote ip this should also be removed.

Implementation:
Added delete_endpoint method for deleting the stale endpoints from db.
Added tunnel_delete rpc for removing stale ports and flows from br-tun.

Closes-Bug: #1179223

Co-Authored-By: Phani Pawan ppawan@hp.com

Change-Id: I75c6581fcc9f47a68bde29cbefcaa1a2a082344e

"}, {'created': '2014-09-23 11:07:21.000000000', 'message': "Stale VXLAN and GRE tunnel port deletion

Description:
Stale GRE and VXLAN tunnel endpoints persists in neutron db this should be
deleted from the database. Also, if local_ip of CN or NN changes the
stale tunnel ports and flows persists on br-tun on other CN's and NN's
for that remote ip this should also be removed.

Implementation:
Introduced ml2_tunnel_mappings tables to accomodate (host, local_ip) mapping.
Added delete_endpoint method for deleting the stale endpoints from db.
Added tunnel_delete rpc for removing stale ports and flows from br-tun.
Modified tunnel_sync rpc to process tunnel_types in single call.

Closes-Bug: #1179223

Co-Authored-By: Phani Pawan <ppawan@hp.com>

Change-Id: I75c6581fcc9f47a68bde29cbefcaa1a2a082344e

"}, {'created': '2014-09-29 14:35:45.000000000', 'message': "Stale VXLAN and GRE tunnel port deletion

Description:

deleted from the database. Also, if local_ip of CN or NN changes the
stale tunnel ports and flows persists on br-tun on other CN's and NN's
for that remote ip this should also be removed.

"}, {'created': '2014-11-20 18:44:15.000000000', 'message': "Stale VXLAN & GRE tunnel endpoint deletion from DB

Description:
Stale GRE and VXLAN tunnel endpoints persists in neutron db this should be
deleted from the database. Also, if local_ip of L2 agent changes the
stale tunnel ports and flows persists on br-tun on other Compute Nodes and
Network Nodes for that remote ip this should also be removed.

Implementation

Plugin changes:
Added host column in 'ml2_vxlan_endpoints' and 'ml2_gre_endpoints' table.
Added delete_endpoint method for deleting the stale endpoints from db.
Modified tunnel_sync() method to accommodate these changes.
Modified testcases in test_type_vxlan.py
Modified testcases in test_type_gre.py

Agent changes:
Added tunnel_delete rpc for removing stale ports and flows from br-tun.

commit_message:
Stale VXLAN & GRE tunnel endpoint deletion from DB

Description:
Stale GRE and VXLAN tunnel endpoints persists in neutron db this should be
deleted from the database. Also, if local_ip of L2 agent changes the
stale tunnel ports and flows persists on br-tun on other Compute Nodes and
Network Nodes for that remote ip this should also be removed.

Implementation

Plugin changes:
Added host column in 'ml2_vxlan_endpoints' and 'ml2_gre_endpoints' table.
Added delete_endpoint method for deleting the stale endpoints from db.
Modified tunnel_sync() method to accommodate these changes.
Modified testcases in test_type_vxlan.py
Modified testcases in test_type_gre.py

Agent changes:
Added tunnel_delete rpc for removing stale ports and flows from br-tun.
tunnel_sync rpc signature upgrade to obtain 'host'.
Added testcases for TunnelRpcCallbackMixin().

This patch-set only deals with plugin side changes.

Partial-Bug: #1179223

Change-Id: I75c6581fcc9f47a68bde29cbefcaa1a2a082344e

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 14504, 'date': '2015-01-06 06:33:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1 Workflow-1

messages: [{'account_id': 8300, 'date': '2015-01-06 06:43:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8300, 'date': '2015-01-06 06:48:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nAlready another patch is submitted : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144409/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-06 06:43:26.000000000', 'message': 'Get volume from db again before updating it's status

During uploading volume to image, if the instance is deleted then
the volume remains in "in-use" status. So get the volume again
from db before updating it's status.

Added new db api called volume_status_update_after_upload. It
gets volume from db and updates it's status using same session.

Change-Id: Ie5a8a39b498b8dc5b9f76c3a8d0b2a099e4c3ad9
Closes-Bug: #1406703
'}]
commit_message:
Get volume from db again before updating it's status

During uploading volume to image, if the instance is deleted then
the volume remains in "in-use" status. So get the volume again
from db before updating it's status.

Added new db api called volume_status_update_after_upload. It
gets volume from db and updates it's status using same session.

Change-Id: Ie5a8a39b498b8dc5b9f76c3a8d0b2a099e4c3ad9
Closes-Bug: #1406703

commit_message:
Display tenant id with nova list --all-tenants

For each server, nova list --all-tenants will now display
its corresponding tenant ID as well.

Change-Id: I586d6c5bbb15ebb5df25dc4fa849ac4d5af149e9
Closes-bug: #1403431

[{'created': '2015-01-05 22:09:41.000000000', 'message': 'After the addition of ZFSSA NFS driver, the configuration table xml file for zfssa
needs to be split into two separate files, so that documentation for iSCSI and NFS drivers
can reference them separately. The documentation for ZFSSA NFS driver will be submitted as part of another patch.

Change-Id: Idc20abf695b4d44479f42865e409b7d79fbb2b68
Closes-bug: 1407795

commit_message:
After the addition of ZFSSA NFS driver, the configuration table xml file for zfssa
needs to be split into two separate files, so that documentation for iSCSI and NFS drivers
can reference them separately. The documentation for ZFSSA NFS driver will be submitted as part of another patch.

Change-Id: Idc20abf695b4d44479f42865e409b7d79fbb2b68
Closes-bug: 1407795

commit_message:
Update the command list

We've been making changes to the commands.rst file as we
add command docs, looks like we missed a few.

Also fixed a few typos

Change-Id: Ie93280a7e5ba37303a1984a68870b5a4fc5c6e06

commit_message:
pci: move filtering of devices up into resource tracker

There is no particular reason why each virt driver impl should
have to remember todo filtering of PCI devices. It is simpler
for each virt driver to just return the full list of PCI devices
and then have the resource tracker do any filtering.

Cleanup before blueprint: resource-objects
Change-Id: I38372826a1c45247c9c24db55c48939f04f24b13

commit_message:
Removed obsolete db_auto_create configuration option

When this part of 'Use common db code from oslo' blueprint was merged
into master: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/36207/ some code related
to db_auto_create was removed but some still remained in tempest tests,
documentation and configuration samples.
This fix removes every reference to db_auto_create option.

Closes-Bug: #1343907
Change-Id: Ibca3f633e61574d77339fc98fdf73340c9d9b8dc

commit_message:
Fix document issue of image recover status

Based on current implementation, image in pending_delete
status can't be recovered. This patch will fix the
document issue.

commit_message:
update sample conf using latest oslo.conf

oslo.conf 1.6.0 is now available which uses the order that the
options are defined in rather than alphabetizing.

Change-Id: If2d73ae9909231d3fb3935c061c5da68f8d5ea41

commit_message:
Use oslotest.base.BaseTestCase as test base class

Switch to BaseTestCase as base class for all Manila test classes.
This BaseTestCase class automatically uses the following fixtures:

 * fixtures.FakeLogger (only if needed)
 * fixtures.NestedTempfile
 * fixtures.TempHomeDir

so we don't have to explicit add them to our constructor.

Change-Id: I336d024f7008f5300e1882fa960a8e32439a9a70

commit_message:
Remove unused sslutils module

The sslutils module from olso-incubator is not used by Manila so remove it.

Change-Id: Iadf05570d6cbfc3dda22c9647ee710dd8d1a580e

commit_message:
libvirt: move setting of guest features out into helper method

Move guest features into a separate helper method, since there
will be more complicated guest features to be set in the guest
config in the future.

Related-bug: #1400315
Change-Id: Icf575ab1d6eb2a011c08efd998997d0d82aa15a6

Oslo.config 1.6.0 was recently released which updated the config sample
generator. This changes the sample generated for the pep8 job. This
commit updates the in repo sample config file to allow the gating job
to pass again.

Change-Id: I76b94f9bd99d283dac0b2246654d14c4d25d2f65

commit_message:
Update sample config

Oslo.config 1.6.0 was recently released which updated the config sample
generator. This changes the sample generated for the pep8 job. This
commit updates the in repo sample config file to allow the gating job
to pass again.

Change-Id: I76b94f9bd99d283dac0b2246654d14c4d25d2f65

commit_message:
Add unit tests for the conductor AMQP API

This tests create and delete at the AMQP level and makes certain the AMQP
code is being called.  This does not actually test the connection to the
handlers, which would be more like a functional test.

This test case purpose is meant to introduce pain when changing the
interface.  The interface should not be changed, a new version should
be implemented.

Change-Id: Icfca04df842497515c20138ba58694805b266b55

commit_message:
Fix improper syntax in cinder.flagmappings

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/143764/ introduced an incorrect syntax
in the cinder flagmappings. This patch restores a correct version.

Change-Id: I6b45fb1ee882496af5050c4f7fe651978bb0afed

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary oslo incubator bits

Remove the following from our sync'ed oslo incubator section:

  * openstack/common/config/*

Since we are now using oslo.config.

Also remove the following:

  * openstack/common/gettextutils.py
  * openstack/common/importutils.py

Since only config/generator was using it.

Also, tweaking keystone/i18n.py since it made reference to
gettextutils.py.

Removing the no longer sync'ed parts from openstack-common.conf

Change-Id: Idc62fa1093251f5719868c1fffd82810eb87fc08

[{'created': '2015-01-05 20:13:20.000000000', 'message': 'Use pkg_resources resolve() and require() instead of load()

setuptools 11.3 deprecated the require flag to load() in favor of two
new methods. If those methods are present, use them instead of calling
load(). If those methods are not present, continue to use load() as
before.

Change-Id: I800eec863e34ba4c7a90153e6ae2bfa953bfddd6
Closes-bug: #1407778
'}]
commit_message:
Use pkg_resources resolve() and require() instead of load()

setuptools 11.3 deprecated the require flag to load() in favor of two
new methods. If those methods are present, use them instead of calling
load(). If those methods are not present, continue to use load() as
before.

Change-Id: I800eec863e34ba4c7a90153e6ae2bfa953bfddd6
Closes-bug: #1407778

commit_message:
Ensure PostgreSQL connection errors are wrapped

Currently PostgreSQL connection errors are not wrapped with our
custom DBConnectionError and engine.connect() will raise
OperationalError instead.

Change-Id: Iefdb9a99ca0cbe982bf12cb7e1ac47996fc5a025

oslo_serialization. Retain the ability to import from the old namespace

bp/drop-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Ic60f809ea00ac77b0753556c6fd00b97e64d57ff
'}]
commit_message:
Move files out of the namespace package

Move the public API out of oslo.serialization to
oslo_serialization. Retain the ability to import from the old namespace
package for backwards compatibility for this release cycle.

bp/drop-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Ic60f809ea00ac77b0753556c6fd00b97e64d57ff

commit_message:
Remove usage of BayLocked

The API had an exception that is not being used (BayLocked)
being executed.  The API calling the exception is not used
by the codebase.

Change-Id: Ib4c6ea7f3a7bf82a136e4234c7d618444413b46d

commit_message:
Use Cinder v2 API within Generic driver

Manila uses v1 Cinder API for it's Generic driver.
Cinder v1 API is deprecated and is going to be removed,
see: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/deprecate-v1-api
So, update our Generic driver to use v2 Cinder API.

Implements blueprint v2-cinder-api-for-generic-driver

Change-Id: I3cbd713a9a4c6eccee50ba4af4bdf2794db021d7

commit_message:
Add sub-site for Portuguese

Fernando Pimenta and the OpenStack Brazil team have finished
the translation of the install guide. This patch adds the
necesssary web components to display it on docs.openstack.org

Change-Id: I783a1e0b4e122e64b831cc508a8a3f7caee6bcc4

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary import of eventlet

Since 'eventlet.backdoor' is also imported, there is no reason to
also import 'eventlet', as the former.

Change-Id: Ic404496f9c4bf297b0a625da1d3d31a6d12045ae

commit_message:
Add test and refactoring on bay_create

This contains temporary implementation of updating master_address, refactoring
rpc handler and some tests.

Change-Id: Idc88795908441d987d9bb63292daccae523f7cbf

commit_message:
Correct incorrect rst in docstrings

Some docstrings contained invalid docstrings.

Also, changed all :return: to :returns: and :raise to :raises for
consistency.

Change-Id: I5b8fe53871ed9deac13b72a65fa29da36bf2f008

commit_message:
Cellsv2 devref addition

This adds some initial information on the cells v2 effort into the
devref.  We start by adding a manifesto explaining what we are trying to
accomplish.

Change-Id: Iff050e0fc9790c945f6a946d0d415ea72b40642f
Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dms@danplanet.com>

commit_message:
Nuke XML support from Nova REST API - Phase 1

In I5a580fc323c3809790b4a68a9f8f8129ecdc2cf0 we switched off XML support. In
this review we entirely remove all the testcases and supporting files.

Change-Id: I83827d438753fd3899053dd6e09bc77c997c7406

commit_message:
Use a wheelhouse in the integration test

The integration test can take >2 hours running into a timeout. Much of
the time spent in this test is consumed by recompiling dependencies like
lxml. Reduce this overhead by compiling these items once in a
wheelhouse then installing all dependencies from that wheelhouse
preventing recompilation.

Change-Id: I40cd7587ff32f1a4cf881939069dde015dc9589d

commit_message:
Fixes for statsd integration

The reuse of the monascastatsd module as a variable name seems ripe for
confusion so I fixed the naming.

Change-Id: Ib8e2e2abac606f0dc13a06d88ed4f5e3d635970a

commit_message:
NSX plugin security group rules summarization

Summarize the security group rules before creating the rules in NSX
controller. This fix removes duplicate and redundant rules to yield
same or smaller set of rules that enforces the same security
policies on the hypervisors and reduce the NSX control cluster
memory consumption.

Change-Id: Ib654ee400e8dd796d5660000d09c8adaf5dda16e
Closes-Bug: 1376981

commit_message:
NetApp E-series: Do not log passwords in requests

Previously, requests to the backend that contained passwords were
not scrubbed prior to logging.

Closes-bug: 1383444

Change-Id: I389d5115e4a6ffbae6f0463a62015f6ac01ec2e9
(cherry picked from commit: fdaf96621c011e1d0ee2666f8f547d47057f72d0)

commit_message:
Catch ImageNotFound exception when deleting rbd volume

When deleting a rbd volume it is possible for remove() to
throw a ImageNotFound exception. In this case we should
catch the exception, so the volume delete can continue.

Closes-Bug: 1403172
Change-Id: I32cf9d3774c129cda4449996ceeb4b43b7e42904
(cherry picked from commit ddc8d7a4233aee139f9c91aeee885d7f2e45f8ac)

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-11 04:42:33.000000000', 'message': "VPNaas: L3 Agent restructure - observer hierarchy

This commit creates the basic observer hierarchy for advanced
services, as part of a multi-step refactoring effort of the L3 agent.

The change set has these modifications:

- Created VPNService instance and loads device driver.
- Registers for L3 agent notifications (observer).
- Added/updated unit tests for this commit.
- Moved event handlers from VPN agent to VPN service.
- Moved VPN device driver callbacks from agent to service.

Note: the Neutron L3 agent refactorings will like be changing
some of the event notifications, so the naming and content of
handlers may change.

Note: since 136549 has not upstreamed yet in Neutron, the
advanced_service.py base class is not available (so PEP8 fails).

Please keep these things in mind, when reviewing:
- The goal is to refactor the code and not 'improve/change'
  functionality (other than broken tests).
- This is one step of a series of steps to move to the 'final'
  restructuring.
- Because we're incrementally changing the code, there may be
  temporary changes to allow existing code to continue to work.

Change-Id: I674c72e37b56aa1f729110310e6f697297c47c09
Partially-implements: blueprint restructure-l3-agent

commit_message:
VPNaas: L3 Agent restructure - observer hierarchy

This commit creates the basic observer hierarchy for advanced
services, as part of a multi-step refactoring effort of the L3 agent.

The change set has these modifications:

- Created VPNService instance and loads device driver.
- Registers for L3 agent notifications (observer).
- Added/updated unit tests for this commit.
- Moved event handlers from VPN agent to VPN service.
- Moved VPN device driver callbacks from agent to service.

Change-Id: I674c72e37b56aa1f729110310e6f697297c47c09
Partially-implements: blueprint restructure-l3-agent

commit_message:
Replace oslo-incubator with oslo_context

Context currently being moved out of the incubator to a standalone project.

Change-Id: I4f25ed35a88f82ee934cc35872c66d7a38256408
Closes-Bug: #1210261

commit_message:
Catch InstanceInvalidState for start/stop action

Nova API has a common function that will catch InstanceInvalidState
and report an error with more helpful info. This patch make that
apply to server start/stop operations.

Change-Id: Ia71c73e8452667ddad7941597cd01a43a1c9b174

Hi Amrith,

Please, don't modify the modules from the incubator in the project."}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2014-11-07 09:30:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Flavio,

I understand your concern about my change to be that I am changing code that was earlier synced with oslo-incubator without just sync'ing with oslo-incubator.

I submit to you that this is not really the case, as the only change(s) I've made to the code that trove imported from oslo-incubator is in the realm of import lines, something that would have to be changed as a matter of course when importing code from oslo-incubator. If I was changing the body of code (i.e. other than the location of an import), I would buy your argument.

Refering to the original email from Doug and seeing changes that were mentioned by others in various projects, as part of that email thread, I was able to quickly find the following four that I suggest you take a look at.

In each of these cases, changes (similar to the ones that I am proposing) are being made to code that the project synced from oslo-incubator.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130177/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/128644/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/127923/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/127487/

I submit to you that while your objection is correct (from a purists perspective) it is not something that is practical for a project.

In the specific circumstance that we are in, consider the example that I described to you. Trove has modules that depend on timeutils. Also loopingcall (an oslo-incubator module) depends on timeutils. Since timeutils is now no longer part of oslo-incubator, you advocate keeping timeutils in trove so long as I need loopingcall, and making the trove modules depend on oslo.utils.

This strikes me as problematic."}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2014-11-07 09:32:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2014-11-07 11:22:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-11-07 12:27:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Verified+1

commit_message:
Obsolete oslo-incubator modules - gettextutils (now oslo.i18n)

This change is part of a multi-part change set to handle obsolete and
graduated oslo modules. This commit handles the gettextutils module
which is now oslo.i18n. The change here is to remove it from
openstack-common.conf and point all people who used to use that at
oslo.i18n. requirements.txt has been updated to point to this
dependency.

We aren't deleting gettextutils.py from openstack/common because it is
used by other oslo-incubator modules.

This change has been rebased on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/129668/

Change-Id: I39fd288fb29a8317f896812a2f64bcd69a6b8e21
Partial-Bug: #1380789
blueprint: retire-unused-oslo-incubator-modules

[{'account_id': 13398, 'date': '2014-10-17 02:17:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2014-10-17 02:18:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-10-17 02:47:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-zaqar-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/09/129109/1/check/gate-zaqar-pep8/055dc67 : SUCCESS in 1m 52s

- gate-zaqar-python26 http://logs.openstack.org/09/129109/1/check/gate-zaqar-python26/e86fb66 : SUCCESS in 2m 16s
- gate-zaqar-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/09/129109/1/check/gate-zaqar-python27/c11ecae : SUCCESS in 3m 34s
- gate-zaqar-pypy http://logs.openstack.org/09/129109/1/check/gate-zaqar-pypy/3f1308b : SUCCESS in 2m 37s
- check-tempest-dsvm-zaqar http://logs.openstack.org/09/129109/1/check/check-tempest-dsvm-zaqar/ab2af88 : SUCCESS in 28m 37s
- gate-zaqar-python33 http://logs.openstack.org/09/129109/1/check/gate-zaqar-python33/59057a4 : SUCCESS in 4m 19s'}, {'account_id': 10634, 'date': '2014-10-20 02:17:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

the code is clean now, anyway for me ,it's not very easy to read , -:)

and -1 is just for the typo, not my personal comments above."}, {'account_id': 13398, 'date': '2014-10-20 15:56:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree this makes the changed file harder to read, but it also makes it less necessary to read it.  

Before the change, there were some subtle differences in the methods provided by the meta-controllers and the methods they were forwarding to.  Given that none of those differences were exercised in the test suite, I assume they were unintentional.

I think forwarding the method calls to the underlying driver makes the overall behaviour of the system easier to understand.'}, {'account_id': 13398, 'date': '2014-10-20 15:57:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

*were NOT exercised by the test suite, sorry'}, {'account_id': 6427, 'date': '2014-10-20 23:21:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Thanks for contributing! A few initial thoughts inline. I will take another look tomorrow...'}, {'account_id': 13398, 'date': '2014-10-21 00:05:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Thanks for the review!  Agreed on all points, I'll revise tomorrow."}, {'account_id': 6427, 'date': '2014-10-21 16:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(9 comments)

Added a few more comments. The logic looks sound to me; there are just a few places to polish up and this patch will be ready to rock. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 13398, 'date': '2014-10-22 01:53:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13398, 'date': '2014-10-22 02:01:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Changed based on Peng & Kurt's reviews, and my discussion with Kurt on irc."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-10-22 02:56:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-zaqar-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/09/129109/2/check/gate-zaqar-pep8/43bb0a3 : SUCCESS in 1m 46s

- check-tempest-dsvm-zaqar http://logs.openstack.org/09/129109/2/check/check-tempest-dsvm-zaqar/d0f6aec : SUCCESS in 30m 40s
- gate-zaqar-python33 http://logs.openstack.org/09/129109/2/check/gate-zaqar-python33/f6b9e0b : SUCCESS in 4m 03s'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2014-10-22 15:24:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Hey Rose,

Great work on this patch, It's clear you've put thoughts on it. Thanks a lot!

I'm a bit concern about the implementation, though. I'm not fully sold on the magic this patch does and the things it buy us. It makes everything more compact, less verbose but more obscure and it achieves the same result.

I'm curious to know what you both think about this. As of now, I think I'd rather keep the code as is instead of adding this magic. 

One other concern I have is that I'm afraid the implementation as-is is not as flexible as it seems and we'll end up writing implementations for some methods anyway.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 13398, 'date': '2014-10-22 16:38:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I wondered about this myself.  All the necessary comments seem to reduce the line savings significantly :).  

While there are surely improvements that could be made to this patch, I don't think there's a fundamentally simpler solution using __getattr__.  

That said, there's a *lot* of repetition in these methods.  If __getattr__'s not the right way to eliminate it, something else is.  

I posted a couple suggestions on the bug tracker before working on this - let me know if you'd like to see one of those as a patch."}, {'account_id': 13398, 'date': '2014-10-22 17:03:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Regarding flexibility, it really depends on how many of these methods will have other functionality added in the future.  At the moment, find-the-right-controller-and-forward-to-it is enough for most of them.

One thought: this code could be simplified if the controller methods expected the project argument in a consistent place (either always right after queue, or always last).  It would simplify __getattr__ a bit, and turn `_method_forwarding_info` into just `defaults`, which I think would be much easier to understand at first glance.  

No idea whether such a change would be acceptable.'}, {'account_id': 6427, 'date': '2014-10-22 17:46:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

RIght, so given the two constraints:

  1. Inconsistent use of project param (position as well as args
      vs kwargs)
  2. Inconsistent return/raise behavior when the lookup fails

It is pretty hard to do anything that doesn't feel a little "hacky". I have some ideas, but let's discuss on IRC since these comments aren't a great forum for hashing this out.'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2014-12-01 12:19:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Rose, thanks a lot for all the effort you've put on this patch. I was wondering if you were still interested in moving it forward and getting it ready for merge.

Let us know,
thanks"}, {'account_id': 13398, 'date': '2014-12-02 20:25:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sure, if you think this approach is salvageable.  I spoke with kgriffs, and he suggested doing something different enough that it was worth a separate pr: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/132907/.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-12-09 03:58:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 13398, 'date': '2014-12-10 20:32:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I can rebase this patch if it's wanted.  Can someone clarify?"}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2014-12-10 21:01:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hey Rose! Thanks a lot for working on this. I remember your chat with Kurt and I think its better if we stick with your second patch. I already reviewed it, it looks good! We'll appreciate if you can rebase it. Thanks in advance."}, {'account_id': 13398, 'date': '2014-12-10 21:13:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks Victoria.  I'll do it saturday if not before.  Do I need to do anything to close this one?"}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2014-12-10 22:00:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

If you want, you can abandon this patch and point to the new one. Thanks to you for working on this and sorry for the late review.'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2015-01-05 22:56:55.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This change has been addressed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/132907/.'}]

commit_message:
Remove duplicated code in pooling meta-controllers

The {Queue,Message,Claim}Controller classes have many nearly identical
methods.  This patch extends the __getattr__ method in
RoutingController, allowing the removal of all the methods in the Claim
and Message Controllers, as well as some in QueueController.

Change-Id: I7ce6b0527edc2c5aca97d80f31d1c616bec43874
Closes-Bug: #1351462

commit_message:
Run post_test_hook even when GATE_RETVAL != 0

Projects like Neutron and Nova-docker have code to gather logs in their
post_test_hook.sh. Logs are needed more badly when tests fails. There is
no other way to capture logs unfortunately. So can we please relax this
restriction.

Change-Id: Id9a6aa72a8dee69cf1e73789281fd63385cfe12c

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-18 09:03:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add 'secret_uuid' in _SANITIZE_KEYS for strutils

Cinder volume drivers rbd may return connection_info with'secret_uuid',
This is an example[1], to avoid secret_uuid to be logged in disk,
we should mask its value with "***".

[1]https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py#L745

Change-Id: I5c9d688126f3dbcebc67162e749da9a34a4bb2b9
'}]
commit_message:
Add 'secret_uuid' in _SANITIZE_KEYS for strutils

Cinder volume drivers rbd may return connection_info with'secret_uuid',
This is an example[1], to avoid secret_uuid to be logged in disk,
we should mask its value with "***".

[1]https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py#L745

Change-Id: I5c9d688126f3dbcebc67162e749da9a34a4bb2b9

[{'created': '2014-12-26 02:22:10.000000000', 'message': "Tests with controller methods in test_simple_tenant_usage

In API unit testing, making call through WSGI is little bit overhead,
wherever applicable, unit tests can make direct call to controller
methods.
Also URL given in controller method's request is not used
(for direct call to controller methods), so pass blank URL
to avoid confusion as tests are shared between V2 & V2.1

This patch makes above cleanup in test_simple_tenant_usage.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I2287ff6e793241767a144ec888853d01f0702eaa
"}, {'created': '2015-01-05 01:56:57.000000000', 'message': "Tests with controller methods in test_simple_tenant_usage

In API unit testing, making call through WSGI is little bit overhead,
wherever applicable, unit tests can make direct call to controller
methods.
Also URL given in controller method's request is not used
(for direct call to controller methods), so pass blank URL
to avoid confusion as tests are shared between V2 & V2.1

This patch makes above cleanup in test_simple_tenant_usage.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I2287ff6e793241767a144ec888853d01f0702eaa
"}]
commit_message:
Tests with controller methods in test_simple_tenant_usage

In API unit testing, making call through WSGI is little bit overhead,
wherever applicable, unit tests can make direct call to controller
methods.
Also URL given in controller method's request is not used
(for direct call to controller methods), so pass blank URL
to avoid confusion as tests are shared between V2 & V2.1

This patch makes above cleanup in test_simple_tenant_usage.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I2287ff6e793241767a144ec888853d01f0702eaa

commit_message:
Make sure run_cross_tests.sh installs all files

Rebuild the egg_info directory for the package to ensure that the list
of source files is up to date before pip tries to install the package.
This ensures that tests for libs where we are renaming the python
package install all of the files in their new locations.

Change-Id: If5fb35ea7e2bafa5586850b9a42beff60be3dbd9

wherever applicable, unit tests can make direct call to controller
methods.

(for direct call to controller methods), so pass blank URL

"}]
commit_message:
Convert wsgi call to controller in test_virtual_interfaces

In API unit testing, making call through WSGI is little bit overhead,
wherever applicable, unit tests can make direct call to controller
methods.

Also URL given in controller method's request is not used
(for direct call to controller methods), so pass blank URL
to avoid confusion as tests are shared between V2 & V2.1

This patch makes above cleanup in test_virtual_interfaces.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ibd0a18ad738242d54da841c504355808b91fca2c

commit_message:
Customizing tempest configuration for libvirt-lxc

In order to support the continued testing of the libvirt driver
with lxc virtualization, certain compute features must be disabled
including allow_tenant_isolation, rescue, resize, suspend, and
xml_api_v2.

Change-Id: I2425b69333dd8f19cdc08de2be8c2bfb3745fc14

Remove extra white space in log message

The log message contains an extra white space between the two
sentences. Remove it.

Change-Id: I78f00db9f377e34245fc93cd5be3cd4609615fad

commit_message:
Add tr to filter for trove logs

For files: screen-tr-api.txt.gz, screen-tr-cond.txt.gz, screen-tr-tmgr.txt.gz

Change-Id: I5020fe2fce498f4b66abf2a3ace64302108a8975

commit_message:
Make rebuild server schema 'additionalProperties' False

Nova V2.1 API has strong input validation by making validation
through JSON schema.

This patch makes rebuild server schema 'additionalProperties' to False
as all rebuild server extensions are implemented in V2.1.
After this, V2.1 will not allow extra arg for rebuild server.

This patch also modify the corresponding rebuild server tests
for extra input passed in request body-
    test_rebuild_admin_password_pass_disabled
    test_create_and_rebuild_server
    Access ip extension sample files

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ib13b02cefb9617e8af3b62b81d2f7eb7cd88eab1

commit_message:
Skip load balancer API test for ipv6 network

Default loadbalancer backend is haproxy version 1.4
which doesn't support ipv6. That leads to check-grenade-dvsm-neutron
job failures.

Need to skip this test until noop driver is used in tempest
configuration/API test or until backend supports ipv6

Change-Id: Ida4559752df827393845b1a78e562d69694d06ed
Closes-Bug: #1402007

Do we have any documents about driver modes ?
I'm a little confused, not sure if my understanding is correct.

There are two driver modes currently, single_svm and multi_svm.
For generic driver, each share network has its own service instance.
So, multi_svm mode means no "share" service instance for different networks ? 

But,for gluster, no service instance needed at all, why it is single_svm mode ?'}, {'account_id': 8851, 'date': '2014-12-29 09:51:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

li,chen

"multi_svm_mode" means usage of share-networks that contain network info for dynamic creation of share-servers (SVMs). "single_svm_mode" means usage of predefined some endpoint, without need to provide share-network and without creation of share-servers (SVMs).'}, {'account_id': 6116, 'date': '2014-12-29 12:52:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Valeriy Ponomaryov	

Strongly suggest to change these two mode names. multi&single are definitely confusing.

Maybe dynamic_svm_mode & no_svm_mode ?'}, {'account_id': 6116, 'date': '2014-12-29 12:54:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

-1 for confusing mode names.'}, {'account_id': 8851, 'date': '2014-12-29 12:58:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

li,chen

This change is not related to naming of driver modes. This change adds current mode of driver to its stats for scheduler.'}, {'account_id': 6116, 'date': '2014-12-30 00:22:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Valeriy Ponomaryov
	

Sorry, forget that.
Updated https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144387/.'}, {'account_id': 8851, 'date': '2014-12-30 21:00:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 8851, 'date': '2014-12-30 21:11:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Commit message was updated'}, {'account_id': 8851, 'date': '2014-12-30 21:11:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Commit message was updated'}, {'account_id': 8851, 'date': '2014-12-30 21:11:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Commit message was updated'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-12-30 21:55:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Verified+1

commit_message:
Add driver mode attr definition for all drivers

Driver mode functionality was implemented to be able to specify how
driver should work and filter backends scheduling share creation based on this.
Add to all drivers update of attr 'mode' based on its current behavior.

Set 'share_driver_mode' extra spec to volume/share type with one of available
values. Scheduler will use it for host filtering.

Implements blueprint driver-modes-for-scheduler

Change-Id: Ida644f630ee07c51c02aea5d6280980b5d704c2f

commit_message:
The DRBD(manage) Cinder volume driver

This driver allows to use DRBD 9, via the DRBDmanage Dbus API,
as a Software-Defined-Storage backend.

Cert test result: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1400834

Change-Id: Ia0851ddaf405044978343f61cf22c61e7f6682c2

commit_message:
Fix wrong calling of selenium driver function

Selenium docstrings define the usage of this function to be called as
driver.current_url but integration tests call it in wrong way as
driver.current_url() which throws an error if you try to use it that way.
Read the bug for detailed info on this and its source.

Change-Id: I9b065ffb495b637dfe4582edf4aa216a833d5058
Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing
Closes-Bug: #1404379

commit_message:
Enables H302 rule

Also some preparations for enabling H305-307 rules

Partially implements: bp add-openstack-hacking-checck
Change-Id: Ibd99fb86d0fffb8fca1a0bd58fc5d4746b027554

commit_message:
Drop workarounds for python2.6

We drop python 2.6 support in Kilo, so we can remove workarounds
for python2.6 now.

Change-Id: I18b6a1adf398a5fc8f75d0f6276f6896846dbf3a

Merge Failed.

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2014-12-21 20:32:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This fails entirely if we try to provide credentials via the auth parameter. Comments from other patches apply here.

The merge conflict seems to be because you've changed some existing file lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user_role/openstack.rb instead of removing lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user_role/keystone.rb and replacing it with lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user_role/openstack.rb."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2014-12-22 07:33:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I have taken the liberty of proposing an alternate patch for this work. I feel very strongly that these provider rewrites should be consistent with one another. If reviewers find issues with one way of writing these, we should resolve those issues rather than writing half of the providers in a different way. Consistency is easiest to accomplish if there is only one person doing the work. Moreover, my vision of this rewrite is that it is our chance to clean up crufty, ugly, and unnecessary code, as well as to not just fix the unit tests that don't pass but also to add tests to more fully cover this code. Since this was my vision, I think it makes sense for me to take on that work. The patch is up at https://review.openstack.org/143384. I appreciate the work you've done so far on this and I hope my proposals are not too much of an overstep."}, {'account_id': 9983, 'date': '2015-01-05 21:00:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

superseded by https://review.openstack.org/143384'}]

Moreover, my vision of this rewrite is that it is our chance to clean up crufty, ugly, and unnecessary code, as well as to not just fix the unit tests that don't pass but also to add tests to more fully cover this code. Since this was my vision, I think it makes sense for me to take on that work. The patch is up at https://review.openstack.org/143383. I appreciate the work you've done so far on this and I hope my proposals are not too much of an overstep."}, {'account_id': 9983, 'date': '2015-01-05 16:23:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

+1 to everything you said.  I did not mean to step on your toes.  My only concern was to help get Keystone API V3 support into puppet-keystone as soon as possible.  I hope that my patches were helpful and not a hindrance.'}, {'account_id': 9983, 'date': '2015-01-05 21:00:27.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

superseded by https://review.openstack.org/143383'}]

commit_message:
Use openstackclient for keystone_user

This is based on the wip in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/134843/
and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/134844

This commit allows the keystone_user type to use the openstack provider.

Change-Id: I0d6ca4b5eee24fd91f7e64e31ff3a2ab9acf12b5

commit_message:
Catch ImageNotFound exception when deleting rbd volume

When deleting a rbd volume it is possible for remove() to
throw a ImageNotFound exception. In this case we should
catch the exception, so the volume delete can continue.

Closes-Bug: 1403172
Change-Id: I32cf9d3774c129cda4449996ceeb4b43b7e42904
(cherry picked from commit ddc8d7a4233aee139f9c91aeee885d7f2e45f8ac)

commit_message:
Remove /mnt/sys support

This code was here to allow IPA to be ran inside a docker container
with /sys bind-mounted in to /mnt/sys. IPA no longer can run inside
a docker container anyway, so remove this.

Change-Id: Ia6a9c2e49870b7a74087e3fed2fc42d5b8b6b81c
Closes-Bug: #1404362

commit_message:
Remove configdrive builder

We're leaving this up to Nova these days, remove the unused code
here.

Change-Id: I2c4ac1bffa59146ae54c8b758f62314454aa8369
Partial-Bug: #1404362

commit_message:
libvirt: add support for configuring hyperv enlightenments in XML

Extend the guest XML config classes to cope with the following
hyperv enlightenments:

   <features>
     <hyperv>
       <relaxed state='on'/>
       <vapic state='on'/>
       <spinlocks state='on' retries='4095'/>
     </hyperv>
   <features/>

Related-bug: #1400315
Change-Id: Ieff2ae44bf90e09152a56859709707ccdf83cbc9

Disabling user's current project is like shooting yourself in the foot
- once it's done, it's irreversible in the current tenant because it's
no longer possible to edit any Project/User/etc. Hence it should be
forbidden.

Also disable the same operation via inline-editing of the
corresponding cell in Projects table - to make this possible, a new
argument `is_edit_available` was added to the Column.__init__, with a
default value of `lambda request, datum: True` which doesn't break
existing behavior. Add a test for the inline editing entries being
hidden due to the specific value of `is_edit_available`.

Closes-Bug: #1398331

commit_message:
Prevent user from disabling her current project

Disabling user's current project is like shooting yourself in the foot
- once it's done, it's irreversible in the current tenant because it's
no longer possible to edit any Project/User/etc. Thus it is forbidden
both when using Edit Project modal or when inline-editing the
corresponding cell at Projects table.

Closes-Bug: #1398331
Change-Id: Iacca383f1d982a9b16c41c9f945fdcdde9f803a1

* Revert "Added validation on proxy domain for 'hiveserver' process"

commit_message:
Fixed vanilla1/2 cluster not launched problem

* Add use_domain_for_proxy_users checks for cluster-scoped TRUST generation
* Revert "Added validation on proxy domain for 'hiveserver' process"
(bb55efbbfa261a6702f141230197f053e53dfc94)

Change-Id: I796d701cb0995d85c66c42988600525b4e4c7fab
Closes-Bug: #1407595

A couple of nitpick comments but this LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2014-12-17 06:38:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Commenting on here instead of a spec because the spec merged and theres not a spec change up at the moment.

I brought this up before, but while reviewing this I realized another good reason we should not be interpreting and validating any fields from within the order 'meta' property. Doing this is a backwards incompat plugin API change. The contract the plugin API gives is that plugins can implement any field they wish from within the meta block. So a plugin could have, for example, implemented its own meaning for 'request_type' which is completely different from what we have defined here. In this case we would be breaking any of those plugins even though they are simply following the API we have created."}, {'account_id': 7789, 'date': '2014-12-18 00:57:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add validation for certificate-order-api

This commit adds the basic framework for validation code needed
for the common cert API.  Note that there is a slight change to
the blueprint in that for the stored-key type, we expect to see
a container_ref rather than a public_key_ref, so that certain
validations (like access to the private key) can be done.

We expect subsequent commits to fill in the missing logic in the
functions and enable the relevant tests.  Also, once this process
is complete, it makes sense to refactor the Validator code along
the lines of bp/split-validator-module.

Implements: blueprint certificate-order-api
Change-Id: Ieffd0c6f8b97b9bb5b1d0d4cf9e8eea0a6277ca0

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Initial amphora status daemon

Initial status daemon. What's done:
sends udp to both ipv4 and ipv6
calculates hmac
has config file in json
initial command line arg parsing
a few unit tests

Not done:
config file changes
signal support
communication from API on amphora

Serious work in progress

Change-Id: I1e7759335ac43364d27e3176cf813c4f6ef549cb

commit_message:
Remove condition check for python2.6 in test_glance

We drop python2.6 support in gate, so we can remove
the condition check now.

Change-Id: Ia01c1cbfb41bd8efa5ac7a61fd3d61f97f3c09f2

commit_message:
PXE: Pass root device hints via kernel cmdline

The way we pass information from Ironic to the PXE deploy ramdisk is via
the kernel cmdline, this patch is adding a new 'root_device' argument to
the PXE template which will contain the root device hints so the ramdisk
knows which device it should pick to deploy the image onto. If no hints
are specified then 'root_device' option won't be passed.

Change-Id: I527f3d3f3115dbfd08d3a6f76eeb14712f29adca
Implements: blueprint root-device-hints

Thanks for the updates Roman. I'm good with this, except for the dependencies pulled in with policy stuff. I'm not sure whether we should have a separate patch that pulls in the dependencies first. Eg, adding _18n.py means that we have duplicated stuff in there and in gettextutils.py. (I'm not sure if there are other things to 'clean up'; that's what I noticed.)

I'm fine if there is a follow-on patch/bug to track what else ought to be done."}, {'account_id': 6623, 'date': '2014-12-23 18:13:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Ruby, thanks for you're input, I thought about moving that into a separate patch but then what will be the logical background for that? "Sync mod1, mod2 and mod3 but not policy" does not sound sensible.

Indeed we have gettextutils, but _i18n is not a duplicate but rather a hack, required for some of the oslo modules. oslo.i18n lib was already used in Ironic and should have replaced gettextutils but somehow other oslo modules depend on it so we cannot just remove it for now.'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2014-12-23 21:52:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Yeah, I dunno what the right solution is. Since the master branch of oslo doesn't have gettextutils anymore, I suppose one solution is to upgrade whatever modules we use from oslo incubator, so none of them use gettextutils and use _i18n instead. But I'm not familiar with all this stuff.

Anyway, that's why I ok'd this :-)"}, {'account_id': 7244, 'date': '2014-12-23 21:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7882, 'date': '2014-12-24 00:07:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7711, 'date': '2014-12-24 14:35:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2015-01-05 15:55:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-01-05 15:55:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: -Verified

commit_message:
Refactoring for Ironic policy

 - Synchronised OSLO policy and its dependencies to the
   newest version.
 - Replace policy-related code in Ironic with a proper
   configuration of the common policy engine;

related commit 07e9b32a95352c25a611a93d215878a8b9a36b71
        commit b19af0806f0e2dffc83607d39a88e408928da72c
        commit 2324c77549f0affeda854ac3e7a500097450bb6a
        commit a51469326e84ed977ecc4e57fd3d46cdc21aa08f
        commit fde1e156a38633ce9018569145390bce2047fea8
        commit e700d926f7d8fe2f57e53b93361aaf281bebc8ed
        commit 65e3d8c9773880094c0a4c164e046fae9cb7a5d9
        commit 5d1f15a7785b2597eb9db5700ace9625bd2d44dd
        commit fcf517d72cb81f972fad20caa9ff0341e9b4aa9c
        commit e038d896174ada12c4d8b1ddafda2834d9ed0b14

Change-Id: I4ede79ec7e56a6a7c5ca3d69d3b4fb9d2f4ada22
Closes-Bug: #1288178

This switches keystone to use oslo-config-generator, where the contents
of our sample configuration file are configured using a configuration
file in config-generators/, because the only way to have tox create

commit_message:
switch from sample_config.sh to oslo-config-generator

This switches keystone to use oslo-config-generator, where the contents
of our sample configuration file are configured using a configuration
file in config-generators/, because the only way to have tox create
files is to have configuration files for your configuration files
(seriously, it chokes when redirects are included in the command for a
test environment).

This also takes advantage of oslo-config-generator's ability to set the
line wrap width, which is done at 79 chars here to match the rest of our
code.

Also update the actual sample file under etc/

Change-Id: I9f9a157c7802c56a2c7484f6f4adec4aeb4071b8
Closes-Bug: 1324610

[{'created': '2014-09-29 09:30:52.000000000', 'message': "Add CPython debug symbols packages to mirrors

We now build custom CPython packages to be used in MOS deployments,
which means that debug symbols provided by distros don't correspond

for debugging of hanging CPython processes.

Change-Id: I9a1f4124e16dd3374840736aea03d0fad5812da6
"}]
commit_message:
Add CPython debug symbols packages to mirrors

We now build custom CPython packages to be used in MOS deployments,
which means that debug symbols provided by distros don't correspond
to binaries we run. Without these debug symbols it's hard to use gdb
for debugging of hanging CPython processes.

Change-Id: I9a1f4124e16dd3374840736aea03d0fad5812da6

commit_message:
Add 'sd' None check for check_(action)_complete

If deployment resource action is not in deployment.actions
the function _handle_action() will return None,
in this case should return True when checking whether
the action is completed.

Change-Id: I6f929f944f00385bc832b9d73c24659db6cdc8dc
Closes-Bug: #1406688

commit_message:
Log directly to syslog from os services

We currently have a horrible hack for upstart where we run our services
with stdout and stderr piped into logger. There are lots of issues with
this, such as upstart has a hard time knowing which PID to track.
Conveniently, python logging knows how to syslog, so why not just use
that!

This changes the default behaviour of os-svc-daemon to create a python
logging.conf so services log directly to syslog.

This also changes the default upstart respawn limiting to be 2 fails in
10 secs. This is becauce making upstart monitor the actual service
daemon was causing some services to respawn loop due to time it took
them to fail.

Closes-Bug: #1385346

Change-Id: Ibd491881d79160ad1457526d51512f5fc1cf9ea5

commit_message:
Prepares to turn on exluded hacking rules

Enables rules:
 H101 Use TODO(NAME)
 H201 no 'except:' at least use 'except Exception:'
 H233 Python 3.x incompatible use of print operator
 H234 assertEquals is deprecated, use assertEqual
 H301 one import per line

Partially implements: bp add-openstack-hacking-checck
Change-Id: Idc14dd305ad938c036769e658183817f59ab60e4

commit_message:
Adds session_engine variable for memcached config

The local_settings.py has the ability to use memcached for caching
in general but does not set the session_engine variable to use it.

Related to Ife7137054eafba548d13c58265abd6373679794e

Closes-Bug: #1403685

Change-Id: Icebaf39eda9821ceb99d1348d37a9519c68071ef

Also, we may need to run a migration for existing launchpad projects.'}, {'account_id': 7462, 'date': '2014-12-23 16:06:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2014-12-23 17:10:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

More community support for puppet-openstack project in storyboard.'}, {'account_id': 6609, 'date': '2014-12-23 17:18:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

"OpenStack Puppet Dev Environment" is not included in this patch, is that intentional?'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2014-12-23 17:27:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Elizabeth: yes, this repo is not actively supported and used by our community as far I know.
Also, I'm waiting for fungi review who had interesting thoughts about this patch on IRC.
I'm not sure StoryBoard is ready enough for our needs.
Please don't merge it before he can make a review."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2014-12-23 20:10:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

I wait for feedback from fungi, who told me storyboard was too early stage for our needs right now.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2014-12-24 03:42:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Per announcement in http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-November/051117.html and discussion in IRC, Storyboard is still fairly far from the needed feature parity with Launchpad for most projects' needs as an issue tracker (for example it's still lacking tags, E-mail notification, code review system integration, keyword searching is relatively rudimentary, et cetera).

That's not to say that you should definitely not use it for your projects, but make sure you first evaluate whether its current state is sufficient for your community's needs."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-01-05 16:17:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2015-01-05 19:00:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Bring stackforge/puppet modules to StoryBoard

* Ensure all active Puppet modules are in "puppet-openstack" group.
* Configure the projects to use StoryBoard project.

Change-Id: I389c84d0a8cdd92e72f425a80655595f57cb7da6

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-13 20:06:36.000000000', 'message': "radvd: pass -m syslog to avoid thread lock for radvd 2.0+

Since radvd 2.0, the daemon does not use daemon_fork() function from
libdaemon, but instead calls Linux daemon() function directly. It also
passes (1, 1) arguments when logging method (-m) is either stderr (the
default) or stderr_syslog. The second argument's value = 1 means that
stderr is not closed and left there for (some) log messages.

For neutron, it means that corresponding execute() call that spawns
radvd and expects the invoked process to close stderr does not ever get
completed. The current thread that spawned radvd is locked waiting for
radvd to exit, which does not ever occur unless the process crashes or
receives a signal.

Since L3 agent gives exclusive access to updates queue for each router
to one of processing threads only, it means that the thread that got to
serve a radvd-powered subnet will not proceed and not update any new
ports or other changes to the router anymore.

Passing -m syslog makes radvd 2.0+ close stderr and return to execute()
caller, proceeding with router update processing. The same arguments
should work for old (pre 2.0) versions of radvd too, so passing them
unconditionally.

We could instead use -m logfile and pass appropriate -l <logfile>
argument to radvd to make it log to a log file located in router's
namespace storage path. Though that would be not in line with what
dnsmasq processes currently do for dhcp agent, where we log all messages
to syslog, so sticking to syslog for radvd for consistency.

Change-Id: I131db0639bc46d332ed48faa2bbe68a214264062
Closes-Bug: #1398779
(cherry picked from commit 72d41174765540bb7672b545c336fb7aaad075e8)

commit_message:
radvd: pass -m syslog to avoid thread lock for radvd 2.0+

Since radvd 2.0, the daemon does not use daemon_fork() function from
libdaemon, but instead calls Linux daemon() function directly. It also
passes (1, 1) arguments when logging method (-m) is either stderr (the
default) or stderr_syslog. The second argument's value = 1 means that
stderr is not closed and left there for (some) log messages.

For neutron, it means that corresponding execute() call that spawns
radvd and expects the invoked process to close stderr does not ever get
completed. The current thread that spawned radvd is locked waiting for
radvd to exit, which does not ever occur unless the process crashes or
receives a signal.

Since L3 agent gives exclusive access to updates queue for each router
to one of processing threads only, it means that the thread that got to
serve a radvd-powered subnet will not proceed and not update any new
ports or other changes to the router anymore.

Passing -m syslog makes radvd 2.0+ close stderr and return to execute()
caller, proceeding with router update processing. The same arguments
should work for old (pre 2.0) versions of radvd too, so passing them
unconditionally.

We could instead use -m logfile and pass appropriate -l <logfile>
argument to radvd to make it log to a log file located in router's
namespace storage path. Though that would be not in line with what
dnsmasq processes currently do for dhcp agent, where we log all messages
to syslog, so sticking to syslog for radvd for consistency.

Juno changes:
- tests: we need to construct RouterInfo to get router namespace name.

Change-Id: I131db0639bc46d332ed48faa2bbe68a214264062
Closes-Bug: #1398779
(cherry picked from commit 72d41174765540bb7672b545c336fb7aaad075e8)

commit_message:
Moved vpnaas.filters from main neutron repo

This file belongs to vpnaas service and hence should be maintained in
neutron-vpnaas repository.

Change-Id: Ide7dafafa3e43b3f27ec3d2dfdb3591ae7328f21

commit_message:
Mount volumes with options for HDFS performance

Enhance disk performance for volumes used as HDFS back-ends, by
disabling unneeded filesystem options and enabling features optimized
for large files.

Change-Id: I3f919f19b83a6bb048a09a9ead6da35821e4174b
Closes-Bug: #1395699

This patch is a weird one, and I feel that this actually brings up a deeper issue with plugins that have functions with same name. Calling these functions can lead into unpredictable results depending on the order that the plugins end up in when stored in self.plugins, because you don't know without inspecting self.plugins which plugin is actually receiving the call."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-10-20 13:43:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

commit_message:
Ensure test_metaplugin handles random hashseeds

2 tests fail in test_metaplugin when using hashseed 2701526934 this is
down to the nature of using dictionaries and sets in Python having
unpredictable ordering when retrieving data stored in them. This patch
ensures that no matter the order fake1 and fake2 get placed into
self.plugins that the test can assert both possible scenarios.

Change-Id: I65fa6979cc0d6e3531e50f249c53db6be83a6cfe
Partial-Bug: 1348818

commit_message:
Fix rate limiting after API url refactoring

The tenant_id used to be the second element in the url, now it is the
third element. Rate limiting middleware was not updated accordingly.

Change-Id: Ibc9987c697f46beb295e3fc27c721a0b42188f68
Closes-Bug: #1404282

Including plugin modifications for barbican container retrieval
Including template updates to support TLS and SNI
Including jinja_config updates to support storing of the container details
Including driver updates for data directory locations

Implements: blueprint lbaas-ref-impl-tls-support

commit_message:
Implement TLS reference impl and jinja configs

Including plugin modifications for barbican container retrieval
Including template updates to support TLS and SNI
Including jinja_config updates to support storing of the container details
Including driver updates for data directory locations

Change-Id: I13ff096eeb512e43d2fc5ba6112c6262ea83242f
Implements: blueprint lbaas-ref-impl-tls-support

commit_message:
Handle URL rewriting of protocol port and host

Added middleware UrlRewriterMiddleware to handle url rewriting because
of SSL termination proxy.

Two ways can be used depending on the deployment requirements:
1. use configured values for protocol/port/host to override original
values
2. use HTTP headers injected by SSL proxy

Change-Id: Ic1c24755203ce3ca7f22a0aa5b0c724e6684bca4
Closes-Bug: #1402791

Hi Ling,

Thank you for the patch, supporting XML in the API is not straight forward since we already depend on JSON PATCH for partial updates, so I think that it's better to simply disable XML in the API instead of partially supporting it.

There's a patch in the WSME queue that allows us to disable XML[1], we need more reviews there apparently :(

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/78108/

Thank you for the patch anyway."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2015-01-05 17:44:07.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Hi Ling Gao. Thanks for the patch. We don't want Ironic to provide XML support, so I'm going to abandon this."}]

commit_message:
Add base function for testing xml response

Current test cases for the web API only test the json responses.
The xml response is not tested.
This patch adds a base test function which sends simulated http GET
request to Pecan test app and gets an xml response.

Change-Id: Ia799960c27a22450ebc1a584aeb54ba6b599f0f5

Tested locally, code works as expected.

I'd love to see a test case written for this. I dove into it and found we use pecan.testing, which uses TestApp from https://github.com/Pylons/webtest.

To implement a get_xml similar to the get_json we have today, you would have to call something like test_app.get(headers={'Accept': 'application/xml'}).

It shouldn't be too bad, but not sure if we should do that here or in a separate patch.

I'm fine with landing this without a test and filing a bug to add one."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-04-25 02:32:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Handle API error for XML client

When there was an error from the API server, the error did not
get shown on the browser. A general message like "A server error
occurred. Please contact the administrator." was shown instead.
This patch fixes it by showing the exact response from the API
server.

Closes-Bug: 1309075

Change-Id: Iad4c579030f73fd2a37331edf1efe50174e61e82

commit_message:
Add get certificates for v2.0

There was no API to fetch the PKI certificates using v2.0.

bp auth-token-use-client

Change-Id: I2b6f9af8b843d72271234fd4d26963b75a25a086

'}, {'created': '2015-01-05 14:00:42.000000000', 'message': 'Enable passing test regex to testr from tox

This will enable us to pass a regex to tox (such as we already can for
testr) of what tests we want to execute. So we can do stuff like this:

$ tox -e py27,py33 -- test_barbican

Which will execute the tests that match that "test_barbican" argument

Change-Id: Id81b8ab4829c25454ee049b22e3e13a551055946
'}]
commit_message:
Enable passing test regex to testr from tox

This will enable us to pass a regex to tox (such as we already can for
testr) of what tests we want to execute. So we can do stuff like this:

$ tox -e py27,py33 -- test_barbican

Which will execute the tests that match that "test_barbican" argument
(which will actually be the tests in the test_barbican module) on the
given environments.

Change-Id: Id81b8ab4829c25454ee049b22e3e13a551055946

commit_message:
Reuse methods from netutils

Replace usages of is_valid_ip_address, is_valid_ipv4,
is_valid_ipv6 from Nova by usages of this methods from
oslo.utils and remove these methods from Nova code

Also removed related tests

commit_message:
Move admin_only_action_common out of v3 directory(cleanup)

This patch moves admin_only_action_common test case out of v3
directory to compute directory since it will be removed in
future
Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api
Change-Id: I4578fb8212adeda2b433059937e4946fd3549006

commit_message:
auth_token config sets service user and project domain

In order to use identity V3 authentication with the auth_token
middleware the user and project domain must be set.

Closes-Bug: #1372142
Change-Id: I876d80df860dca5a7034020ef200c697c7325c1c

commit_message:
Allow storwize private key without san_login and san_password

Using The san_private_key by itself is a common use case. The
current code requires the san_login and password to be set.
This patch allows the key to be used without the login and password.
Also removed some clutter comments from the conf template.

Change-Id: Iea84c8310eec39481c115587219cdac35c9b3589
Closes-Bug: #1398469
